"And make your incision such that it easily severs the adhesion, so that the eyelid returns to its natural form and all of the adhesion is healed."
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	"And then you should put salt water into the eye with which you wash it; or distill in it juniper dissolved in water."
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	"Then separate between the eyelid and the eye with forceps, place a piece of wool soaked in egg white on the eye, and use consolidating ointments on the third day so that it heals."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI."
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	"Of incision of nail and prominence of flesh from the lacrimals."
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	"Know that there are two kinds of nail: one is nervous and resembles hard cartilage; the other is non-nervous and resembles congealed white humor. When you touch it with forceps, if it is forced out, it should be grasped with tweezers, cut off, and the tweezers not inserted into it."
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	"And both kinds begin only from the larger lacrimal canal, which gradually covers the eye and blocks its light and movement."
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	"But the way to operate for its excision is that the patient should hold their head in place and you should open their eyelids. Then lift up the eyelid with your hand and grasp the nail with tweezers without doubling them back too much, stretching it out upwards."
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	"Then take a needle and insert it into the nail under its skin with horsehair or cowhair or wool from oxen or sheep or strong sinew. Then gradually bend back the tip of the needle and insert it into the middle of the nail, pierce it with the needle, and tie the nail with sinew. Then stretch out the nail upwards and cut off its outer side using the hair, taking care not to touch the pupil."
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	"And then follow that same method until you reach the end of it."
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	"And then you should cut off the remainder in the root of the lacrimal canal using a fine spatula or small forceps. Leave the natural flesh of the lacrimal alone so that cutting it does not cause continuous tearing."
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And sometimes the nail can be stretched out with one pair of tweezers or with sinew as we have said. Then it should be cut off using a lion's claw spatula, which has this shape:"
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	"And take care that with the spatula you do not touch the corneal tunic and cause a rupture there. And also take care not to perforate the pupil."
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	"Then place a little crushed salt or fresh egg yolk from chicken on the eye, leaving it there overnight. Then rinse it with water that is suitable for healing so that it heals."
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	"And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot insert the needle into it or grasp it with tweezers, sometimes this kind of nail can be cured with medications. And thus it is treated as other kinds of nail, as described in the division."
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	"And if you want to cut it off, then open the eyelid of the patient and take a fine lion's claw spatula with sharp points like this:"
am subtilitat.	"with sharpness."
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	"And if it becomes softened and congested and enters into its root, then distill from your mouth into the eye fresh egg yolk from chicken or honey or crushed salt. Then close the eyelid overnight."
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	"And then repeat the operation until everything that belongs to it has been removed. But if an opposite tumor appears on the eye, then leave that alone and treat the tumor at its beginning so that it heals."
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	"And then repeat your operation on it with reason until it is healed."
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	"If a prominence of the lacrimal flesh appears in the eye as a great injury, then grasp it with tweezers and cut off one part of it without cutting all the way through so that you do not cause continuous tearing."
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	"And then distill honey and fresh egg yolk into the lacrimal until it heals."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	"Of incision of styes and of anything that is born from attached flesh in the eye."
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	"Sometimes in the eyelids of some people flesh is born that is rough and thick, covering the pupil or approaching it and pressing strongly on the eyelids so that they stick together at their edges like a column."
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	"But the operation for this is that the patient should hold their head in place. Then open the eyelids of that person and grasp all of that flesh with suitable tweezers using a cimeter or forceps. Then cut off the beginning of the flesh until everything is finished without cutting into the eye during your operation."
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	"And let your incision be with whatever you use to cut it off, whether with the spatula that we have recommended in the incision of the nail or with small forceps according to what seems suitable to you according to this chapter."
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	"Then when your incision is completed and all of that flesh has been removed, then fill the eye with crushed salt or distill into it powdered medicine like a corrosive and press on the eyelid from outside with egg white until there is no doubt about the cauterization."
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	"If some cause remains for guarding heat and there is no cautery available, and you fear an abscess will form, then leave the wound open and care for that abscess with whatever makes it yield, and soon return to treat it with operation until it is healed, and similarly do in the case of attached flesh that occurs in wounds of this type."
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	"But you should not remove all care of the wound by force or accidentally with iron tools, and do not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that the limb has tolerated that operation."
Capitol .xviii.	"Chapter XVIII"
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	"Of cauterization of the wound."
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	"Cauterize only the veins that are tough and visible on the wound, and forbid their operation until the wound is uncovered for several days."
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	"Therefore, it is necessary at the beginning that you consider whether the wound in which cauterization takes place is strong and does not have another illness besides cauterization, then you cauterize that wound."
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	"And you should order the patient to hold his head down toward his feet, and then suspend those veins with one or two ounces according to your discretion; and that ounce should be of fine double-folded silk according to this pattern:"
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	"or two ounces graduating in one body according to this pattern:"
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	"And then suspend those veins with fine threads, with subtlety and care, and wipe away the blood hour by hour until you see that those veins are removed from the wound and turned back."
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	"And be careful that you do not cut the wound with the edges of the scalpel blade; and if your operation is in the middle of the day before the sun, and you are very firm in your operation, then you should only cauterize those veins."
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	"And when you have completed the operation, then apply to the wound fresh rue juice or decoction so that with its sharpness it may corrode what has been removed by cauterization."
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	"But if it is not possible for you to do this all in that hour, then you should plaster everything with what relieves the pain of it, and leave it for a few days until the pain is settled and assured against an aposteme."
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	"And then continue to treat it according to the most gentle manner until it is healed."
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	"And this is the form of the cauterizing iron:"
Capitol .xix.	"Chapter XIX."
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	"Of the reduction of a broken nose."
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat burns with cautery or sharp medicine that does not follow the usual course of treatment and fails to heal, then do not attempt to enter the patient's body. Instead, open up the abscess when it is ripe, and extract all the moisture within it until the bone is exposed.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And once the bone has been exposed and you see corruption or blackness in it, then remove it with an instrument shaped like this:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is named "sharp head," and made of iron. Its head is round like this, with many points for fine puncturing by means of a file or aliscale.
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And press that against the corrupted part of the bone, and then twist it between your fingers, gradually pressing harder until you know that the corruption has been scraped away.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And once this has been done several times, then restore the area with drying and astringent treatments.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore, if the area is consolidated and new healthy skin has formed, and the wound has separated from the sound flesh and remains for forty days without being renewed or becoming inflamed or suffering any setback, then you will know that it has healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	But if not, then it is necessary to reduce the wound to the shape of a nose, and do so in this way: first expose the bone using iron or sharp medicine, and once the bone has been exposed, then take a trocar made in this shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	The outer part of the iron should be triangular, and the shaft thin and tapering to a point at its extremity like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	Place that one over the bone, and let it be near the tear duct; extend your hand a little towards the heel, then rotate your hand with the trial in such way that it penetrates all the bone, and the patient feels the pain as much air escapes through there when you move your hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then, restore the place with medicinal remedies that are drying and astringent like those you have here.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Once the flesh has been cut and the place has hardened, then the material that had flowed out returns to its place; therefore, it is easier for the pain to be relieved.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Regarding the reduction of the prominence of the heel.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the heel is entirely prominent and no deformity or diminution has occurred, then you should loosen the pain, follow it up closely, and pause often on the Achilles tendon without scarification and suck well; place a liniment made of acacia, aloe, iris, and tragacanth on the heel, and apply the plaster with plenty of powder.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of preparing the powders is that you take cloths of linseed meal, each cloth folded into four layers; and make them with those meals.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And place one cloth on top of the other according to the amount necessary for the heel.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	Strengthen with rough cloth with strong constraint; repeat the cupping glasses with suction without scarification; then remove them, leaving the wound tight day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	If in the meantime the ligament softens, it is necessary that it be very tight.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And remove the ligaments again during the day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if sometimes the wound is already reduced, that's good; otherwise, then repeat the plaster with powders and constraint and cupping glasses until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the incision of the prominence of the tunic of the eye
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is a rupture in the tunic of the eye and it is prominent and protruding outside the eyelids like a grain of mustard seed, if you want to incise that prominence, then proceed as follows: introduce the needle into the edge of the eye at its lower part and bring it out above; then insert another needle on the side towards the lacrimal gland and let this one penetrate first while allowing the first needle to follow its course; finally, incise where the double thread is located and lift up the edge of the tunic with that thread, pulling it tight.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then remove the needle and place a bandage soaked in egg white on the wound, allowing the thread to remain inside with the eye.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then dress the wound with what will comfort it until the inflammation is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes it happens that the whole prominence is gathered together with a cloth circle around the wound, and then it is punctured with a fine spatula that comes to the front of the wound, allowing the whitish humor to flow out, and then the wound closes quickly.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then compress until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII
De curacio de alconati.	Of the treatment of corneal ulcers
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This condition called corneal ulceration is nothing more than a moist humor that appears on the eye like descending water, but it is not so.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	The method of treating it is to place the patient on a prepared seat and then take your hand in both of yours and press the eye until you see the humor rise towards the lower part; then dry it up so that it does not flow down again, and keep the eye shaded from light, and the patient will see well as before.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow downwards, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the descent of the humor is not prepared with what has been said, then press the eye between your hands and take a fine spatula and stick it into that place where the panicle surrounds a little above the continuity of the conjunctiva with the tunic cornea at the top (where it wants to), until the humor is expelled.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	And then when it is expelled, immediately distill into the eye a drop of water in which you have mixed honey or a decoction of fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	"The treatment of descending water from the womb."
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	"We have already discussed the types of urine and their division, as well as which one is appropriate to collect, clearly stating it according to health."
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now you must hold the patient firmly between your hands over a cushion and tie their head so that they cannot move.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And accordingly place your left hand close to the eyelid of their left eye if the water is in the left eye; or place your right hand there if it is in the right eye.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And accordingly with your right hand take a cotton pad if the wound is on the left side; or with your left hand if it is on the right side.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And accordingly bring the tip of the cotton pad close to the corner of the eye towards the thinner side of the lacrimal bone, and gently press it down with your hand on that point.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And accordingly penetrate into the eye socket until you feel that the cotton pad has reached the back of the wound cavity.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And make sure that the length of the cotton pad reaches from the front to the back of the eye socket cavity so that it touches the pupil at the end of the blackness, i.e. at the corner of the eye; because you will see the pupil clearly with the vision of the eye through the clarity of the cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And accordingly press the cotton pad into the location where the water is present; and then pull it down a few times quickly, and usually the water will descend immediately. Therefore, if the eye pain decreases immediately afterwards, this indicates that the eye has been cured of its ailment and the cotton pad has absorbed the water from within the eye socket cavity.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And accordingly pause for a moment; and if the water has descended, then carefully pull out that other cotton pad making sure not to push it back in again.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And therefore, if the water does not descend, then carefully remove the cotton pad with ease, and gently wipe around that area with your hand little by little; and dissolve a small amount of rock salt in some water and wash the inside of the eye with it; and afterwards close the eye with a cotton wool soaked in rose oil or chamomile oil and bandage it on top.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	However, those of our time pause here upon this matter treated with albumen of egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the cotton pad does not penetrate into the eye due to its hardness -- for some men have very hard eyes -- then you should take the curette called "alberid" which has this shape:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And therefore, pierce with that curette into the conjunctiva, and do not push your hand too far in; otherwise if you cannot reach it with your fingers, make a small opening to allow the cotton pad to enter more subtly.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then insert the cotton pad as we have described.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	You must complete your work, ensuring that the patient's resting place is prepared, a dark house made where they can sleep on their back, and all movements are prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	Pause in the nature of water to clarify its nature, do not move your head towards the right or left side while doing so.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let it be placed according to its disposition within the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	Leave him alone in that dark house and expose him to the clear light, then show him certain reasons, and return the thread on the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	Do not do this during the time of healing or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	You must do this carefully, ensuring that water flows gently rather than violently through the tube.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess occurs, it is necessary to drain the wound on the seventh day and correct the treatment with water that will reduce the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Now you cover his eyes and pause over his mouth so that his breathing can be regulated, letting him rest in the dark house for a few days.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	Then gradually remove him from that dark place and discuss with him the reasons behind it.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	Remember that in alchemy, the apprentice is sometimes deprived of sight for a few moments, and at times you will need to be daring regarding the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And now we have reached the stage of those who are called alchemists, among whom one said that fire should be made in Al-Ayrakh, pierced with a hole through which water is sucked.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But until now, nothing like this has been seen in our land, nor is it written in any of the books of the ancients. Perhaps this is a new invention.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are some of the forms of magnification used to accomplish that which eludes the ignorant:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	These are made of iron or steel, properly tempered, and their extremities are cut in this triangular subtlety with the point being as sharp as this form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of flesh removed from the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When flesh grows in the nose, causing blockages or polyps due to excessive mucus or other causes, this condition is called polyposis, resembling that sea creature.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And the flesh is cancerous, pale, and of dark color; but in some cases it is lion's flesh, not of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	So in cases where it is not fraudulent or cancerous lion's flesh, you should squeeze the lump between your hands and expose it to the sun, open his nostrils, and pierce the tumor with a needle.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	Then carefully extract it from the nostrils and precisely cut that which you have grasped with a sharp, subtle spatula from one side until you know that all the flesh has been removed; but if any cause remains why excision is possible, then remove it with one of the delicate instruments easily without leaving any cause behind.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if there is hemorrhage or an abscess has formed, then pause and do what is necessary; or if it is one of the malignant kinds, then cut it out and cauterize the wound until bleeding stops and all cavities are exposed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	Then sprinkle powdered myrrh and water or wine into the nostrils after the incision has been made.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and there is no longer moisture entering the palate, then you will know that it is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if moisture does not enter as it should, then you will know that flesh has grown in the furrows of the nasal bones where excision has not been performed.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore you should insert fleabane into it where there is thickness and squeeze it with many nuts, pausing between each one the length of your finger or more, and generate heat around it, inserting one end of the fleabane into the nostril with fire or another cause that is possible for you.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after this has been done, let him throw his scent into the air until it reaches the canals of the nostrils and let him exhale onto his cloak, as children often do at school, for it is an easy task to accomplish.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause the two extremities of the fleabane, one outside the nose and the other inside it, and carefully apply pressure with your nuts where there is flesh around the fleabane, doing this until you know that the flesh has been crushed between the nuts of the fleabane.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then remove the fleabane and pause for one day to abstain from blood, doing this for three days or more until the corrosive salve has destroyed all that remains of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of treatment, pause in the nose a lead canula for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you want a drying cure, use this one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument called "capipurge," with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it of silver or brass, resembling a small open lamp like a small cone, with its mouth likewise shaped.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed canula like a pipe, and the opening of the instrument for making capipurge should be flat and uncovered; have a handle at the end of it with which you hold it when you pour oil or any other substance that you want from the juices and subtle causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this capipurge is precious: take from each of the following - beaver, white balm, ginger, saffron, long pepper, iris root, epithymum (or spikenard), and six ounces of wine; infuse with juice of beet and celery, make pills, and administer one pill dissolved in hot water to the sick person until they are cured.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of tumors that grow on the outer parts of the nose
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times a tumor grows on the outer parts of the nose, and it is magnified and augmented in several days until it becomes a great burden to behold.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And therefore you should cut it at the beginning of its appearance and remove all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then pause there with fire or cautery or some burning medicine which is applied to that place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If its incision is delayed until it becomes magnificent, then consider if it is hardened, hard, of dark color and with little sensation, then do not touch that with iron for it is a cancerous ulcer; for many times those who incise this ulcer end up doing great harm to the one they had intended to help.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the ulcer is of lion-like touch and not dark in color, and sometimes incision is possible throughout that area, then evacuate the patient and incise without fear, and dress the wound with something that dries and constrains until it heals.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	On the suturing of the nose, lips, and ear when continuity has been lost due to plague or injury.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when such a solution of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, little confidence should be placed in that operation by certain men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when it happens to someone that there is some cause of these, consider if it is fresh plague with its blood, and then you should approximate the two lips of the wound with sutures, and afterwards dress it so that it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the solution of continuity are already separated and each is healthy, then you should cut off each part of its apparent connection until there comes out no blood.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then approximate the two lips with sutures and strengthen them, and over those sprinkle dragon's blood powder and a little incense, and place on top of it a piece of plaster made from diachylon or some other consolidative plaster, leaving it like that for two days or three, then remove it and change the plaster, allowing the wound to heal by itself. Afterwards dress it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the manner of suturing is that you approximate the solution of continuity either with needles as we have recommended in the suturing of the belly, or with thread as you know how to do.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that appear between the two lips in wounds.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Frequently it happens to many men that in the wounds of their lips there appear hard abscesses resembling boils of ears, some small and others larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary to convert each of those hardnesses by turning the lips and splitting them open with a sharp tool, then fill the space with sage steeped in wine until blood clots, wash it with vinegar, then dress the wound with an astringent so that it heals.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the incision of attached skin on the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	If a granuloma appears on the attached gum, which they used to call an albulus, you should suspend it with tweezers or hold it with your fingers and incise it in its entirety, allowing the pus to flow out and the blood to coagulate.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then apply sage steeped in wine or other astringent powders or ointments to the wound.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that skin returns again, you should incise it once more and cauterize it with a hot iron, for then it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX
De razo de dentz am ferr.	"Due to iron teeth."
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	"If on the surface of the teeth between the interdental spaces and those in front, as well as between the gums, rough, sharp, and sometimes blackish scales appear, with green or yellowish-yellow color seen through the gum, this is a sign of decay and the teeth are loose."
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	"And therefore you should seize the patient between your hands and place their head in a cloth tie, and scrape the teeth on which those scales appear and cause similar sand-like grains to appear without causing any damage, and this is due to the blackness and yellowness and other discolorations."
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	"So if this is the end of that which was at the beginning of the reason, well then. And otherwise, you should repeat the reason on those another day and again on the third day until it comes to the final statement in that which you want."
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	"And know that teeth require various types of tools with different shapes and forms according to what is prepared for your operation."
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	"And therefore take the tool with which you scrape the tooth from its interior and know that it is different from the tool with which you scrape between teeth according to other forms. And these forms of tools should be prepared by you, as you will see soon."
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter XXX."
D’eradicacio de dentz.	"Tooth extraction."
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	"The cause of toothache and its pain is due to the harmful humour that corrupts it. When this humour is eradicated, there is no reason why the toothache should persist, for it is a subtle substance that causes pain during eradication."
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	"Therefore, when a patient comes to have a tooth extracted, you must be firmly assured which is the aching tooth. For often the pain seems to come from another place and you extract one while the pain continues until the diseased tooth has been removed."
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	"So when you are certain which tooth is aching, then you should scrape around it with a spatula having some virtue until it has dissolved from the gum completely. Then remove it with your fingers or fine forceps gradually until it comes loose."
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	"Then take large forceps for good grasp or strong pressure and hold the head of the patient between your thumbs so that he does not move it. Then extract the tooth straightly so that you neither break it nor cause greater pain."
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	"And if it has not come out yet, then take one of those instruments and place it on the outside of the root with ease and force to facilitate removal as was done at the beginning."
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	"But if the tooth is decayed or rotten, then you must fill that decay with wax and strengthen it with a thin wire at its extremity so that it does not break when you grasp it with forceps."
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	"And you must work carefully with your scalpel around the entire gum and guard your strength so that you do not break it nor cause it to separate from its root. Then return to the patient because sometimes the second pain is greater than the first."
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	"And beware of doing what many ignorant barbers do in their haste and audacity to extract teeth without administering what we have recommended. For often they cause great illnesses upon men which are harder to treat than the tooth itself, and sometimes they leave behind roots or pieces of them, or even extract a tooth with some bones from the jawbone as we have often witnessed."
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	"And when extracting it, wash the mouth with hot vinegar or vinegar and salt."
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	"And if there are flows of blood from this, as often happens, then take some quantity of sage and sprinkle it on the wound. If the bleeding does not stop, cauterize it."
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	"The form of the forceps and fine tweezers with which you should grasp the tooth at the beginning should be long in their extremities, short in handle, and thick so that they do not bend when working with them."
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	"And they should be like tongs with a thick handle within which, when you squeeze them, they are not bent. Their extremities should be short."
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	"And they should be made of Indian steel, straight in their extremities. In the extremities of these there should be teeth which interlock with each other and squeeze by descending force. Sometimes the extremities of these are shaped like the beak of a bird called 'ciconia,' that is to say, they are narrow and have great constricting power."
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXXI
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of the Extraction of Teeth and Removal of Jaw Bones That Are Impacted.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When extraction of a tooth that is tightly fixed requires some cause,
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	"The extensions of their limbs are made like lime or scissor cuts."
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	"And if you do not obey this order with these forceps or tongs, then you must cut the skin and expose all the flesh, and insert this tool called 'atal', which is a small lever shaped like this:"
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	"And its short end should be thick and not bent so that it is not broken."
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	"So if by this the skin is opened, it's good. But if not, help yourself with these other tools whose shapes are as follows: the shape of the first tool is triangular at the end, which should have some thickness:"
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	"The shape of the second tool is that it should be triangular and have a very fine tip."
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	"And then you are helped by this tool, which has two branches shaped like this:"
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	"and with other tools that are sharp like teeth. For help is done with this tool which resembles a large eye, and its shape is this:"
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	"of the twisted or short triangular tip, which should have some thickness and not be bent so that it is not broken."
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	"And you should know that tools with moving teeth are similar to other instruments."
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	"But the wise and subtle craftsman finds for himself according to what the operation means to him and the various illnesses. For there are illnesses for which the ancients did not give or set down proper instruments due to the diverse shapes of the species."
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	"But if the bone of the mandible or other bones of the mouth is broken or dislocated, then it should be carefully handled with whatever instrument seems convenient to him for gripping and extracting the roots of teeth, as we have said before. And help yourself with this gesture whose shape is this:"
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	"And little by little it should have some thickness and be squeezed or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the bone is completely reset. And then restore the location with appropriate medicines."
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if there is a small dislocation in the bone, then remove that dislocation and its darkness, and cure it until it is healed."
Capitol .xxxii.	"Chapter XXXII."
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	"Of the treatment of prominent teeth above the others."
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	"When teeth are prominent beyond their natural shape, especially in women and even more so in venerable elderly women. Therefore you should consider: if the tooth is next to another tooth and it cannot be corrected with medication or a splint, then extract that tooth; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then cut that one with this instrument whose shape is like this: it resembles a pig's snout and should be made of Indian steel with a very sharp tip."
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	"And your incision should be made over three days so that it does not cut into other teeth due to the hardness of the tooth."
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And if a prominent tooth is extracted by grinding, then grind it with an Indian steel file whose shape is like this:"
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	"And it should be made of Indian steel and very sharp-edged. And its ends should be made with many small points like the teeth of a comb, with which the tooth is ground little by little over several days with ease, so that other teeth are not cut or damaged."
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	"And finally polish it off and remove it with tweezers."
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	"And if it is a tooth from which one part is broken and it hurts the tongue, then you should grind that edge until its sharpness is smoothed out and flattened so that the tongue does not hurt or speech is not impaired."
Capitol .xxxiii.	"Chapter XXXIII."
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	"Of restoring broken teeth with gold or silver foil."
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	"When teeth are broken by concussion and removal due to impact or falling, and the patient cannot eat because of it, and you have treated them with astringent medicines but your treatment has not been effective, then for those that are held together with gold foil and not silver foil, since silver tarnishes quickly and may corrode within a few days, but gold never changes."
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	"And the foil should be so subtle and thin according to the amount that can fit between the teeth. And the method of attachment is this: take the foil and take twice as much between two healthy teeth, and then curve it with two twists of the foil between the broken ones, or more if there are many, until the foil reaches the other half of the tooth."
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	"And then repeat the wrapping until you reach the beginning of the broken part. Do this with your hand with ease and skill so that it is not further broken."
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	"And your tying should be done between the roots of the teeth so that it does not slip out."
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	"And then cut off the excess ends of the foil with forceps or scissors, and press them together in each place with gesture. And turn them over and hide them between the healthy tooth and the broken one so that they do not cause injury to the tongue."
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	"And leave it like this for three days."
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	"But if it becomes loosened or broken, then fasten it again with more foil in the same manner at all times."
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	"And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two broken ones, as shown in these drawings:"
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	"And when it happens that one or two teeth return to their places after falling, and have been restored as we have recommended, but they become loose again."
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	"This is done only by skilled and knowledgeable artisans."
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	"And sometimes it is appropriate to use bone from cattle for this purpose. It should be fashioned in the shape of teeth and placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and fastened as we have said, and it remains and serves for a long time."
Capitol .xxxiv.	"Chapter XXXIV."
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	"Of cutting the frenulum that comes on the tongue and inhibits speech."
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	"This ligament which lies beneath the tongue sometimes is natural to some people or occurs accidentally and happens due to a hardened plaque."
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	"The operation consists of opening the patient's mouth while his head is tilted back. Then raise his tongue and cut that nerve ligament according to its width until the tongue is freed from its attachment."
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	"But if there is hardness or toughness in that ligament and this has occurred due to hardened plaque, then take an iron nail and cut it lengthwise until you have incised the ligament and dissolved the toughness."
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	"And be careful not to make a wound in the front of the flesh, and cut here carefully so that there is no blood flow."
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	"And then rinse the incision site with warm water or vinegar or hot water, and then place a piece of linen beneath the tongue. This is the method that should be used to hold the patient's tongue in place each night so that it does not become hardened again."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	"But if there is bleeding, place a wet piece of gauze on the site. But if it continues to bleed, then cauterize the site with a silver nitrate stick which should be used for this purpose."
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it according to the other causes until it is healed."
Capitol .xxxv.	"Chapter XXXV."
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	"Of removing a ranula from beneath the tongue."
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	"Sometimes it happens that under the tongue there is an accumulation resembling a small boil which prevents the tongue from moving naturally, and when it grows large, it fills up the mouth."
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	"The operation consists of opening the patient's mouth while he is facing the sun and examining the accumulation."
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	"If you find it to be of ash-gray or blackish hue, hard, when the patient lacks sensation, then do not touch that part as it is gangrenous."
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	"If it is declinated towards whiteness and humidity, then insert the onion into it, and cut that thin skin, cutting it completely; if blood comes out at the time of your operation, then stop quickly, using vinegar as astringent, so that the blood may be restrained."
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And finally, return to your work until you have completed it, ensuring that the wound is washed with vinegar and salt; then apply the other cure with water until it heals."
Capitol .xxxvi.	"Chapter XXXVI."
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	"Of the extraction of an abscess from both ears and that which is located in the navel, and of other abscesses."
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	"When a swelling occurs in the navel area, these are glands which accumulate at times, and when they occur externally, they are called 'ears,' which when cured with water as we have said in the division and it is not healed, then consider whether the abscess is hard, ash-gray in color, with little sensation, then do not touch that part with iron."
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	"And if it is red in color and the root is large, then do not touch that part with iron because of the flow of blood. Let it remain until it ripens, and then you will remove it yourself or it will break open by itself."
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	"And if it is white in color, hard, and its root is thin, then that one should be incised."
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	"And the operation on it is that you consider whether the abscess has already rested and been filled with matter or if it has decreased somewhat. Then do the cutting before sunrise, with the head of the patient lying down and his mouth open, and let the surgeon take between his hands and press the tongue of the patient gently with a very fine instrument, which is shaped thus:"
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	"And it should be made of silver or bronze and should be thin like a scalpel."
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	"Then when you press on the tongue with that instrument and the abscess is revealed to you, cut on it lightly at first, then grasp it with forceps and put it in the pan of water, and pull it outward as much as possible."
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	"After that, if you tear any skin, then immediately cut on it with this instrument which is shaped thus:"
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	"And it resembles forceps, but its ends are curved so that the tip of each is directed towards the other, very sharp, made of iron with a copper coating."
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	"But if this instrument is not available to you, then cut with a scalpel which has the following shape: it should be sharp on one side and not sharp on the other."
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	"And after you have cut one abscess, then cut the other according to this same manner of cutting, and immediately wash out the wound with warm water."
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But if there is a flow of blood, wash it with water decocted from marjoram leaves or myrtle leaves and similar remedies for stopping bleeding until the flow of blood ceases, and then dress the wound until it heals."
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	"And sometimes other abscesses appear around those two ear openings, and cut them according to what I have said regarding the incision of two equal abscesses."
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	"And I had previously treated a woman who had an abscess which had appeared in her groin area, which was dark in color and without sensation, having closed the opening of it, and she was breathing with great difficulty and had been prohibited from eating and drinking water, and if there had not been some intervention on that day or the next, she would have died."
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	"And the abscess had grown so much that it had broken through two places and issued forth through two tracks."
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	"So I treated her surgically and remained at one of those places, and drew that out, but it was such a large piece that it could not be entirely removed. Then I cut into the place where I understood the other track to be, and immediately opened her mouth, pressed her tongue, and placed forceps on that abscess."
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	"And then you cut away a large part of it, and there was only a little blood flowing from it."
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	"Therefore the woman's groin was completely healed, and she began drinking water immediately, then took food. And I continued cutting that abscess many times over a long period, but another abscess kept appearing in its place, which cut into the same track."
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	"So I went away and cauterized her groin with a hot iron, so that there would be no further addition of it. And then I wandered around and did not know what God had done for her on my account."
Capitol .xxxvii.	"Chapter XXXVII."
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	"Of the incision of the uvula when it is abscessed."
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	"When catarr descends to the uvula and it becomes abscessed and elongated, then it is called 'penduncle'; but if it is thick and round at its base, then it is called 'bubble'."
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	"But when it is cured with what we have said in the division and its cure does not confer, sometimes it happens that an abscess which has already cauterized remains there and is subtle. Then you should cut into the one that is attached roundly; and if it is of that length, and is bleeding, of dark color or black, and without sensation, then you should be cautious about cutting it, for there is fear concerning its illness."
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	"And when you find it according to the manner that I have described regarding its whiteness and length, then make an incision into the illness and press its tongue with this instrument whose shape is thus: and then place forceps on the new one, pull that downwards, and cut into it with one of these instruments which are mentioned in the incision of two abscesses."
