"And that cause can be managed in one of three ways: either cauterize it as we have said; or cut it off until the concavity of it is achieved through which you can enter your finger and perform the operation suggested; and do not proceed with cutting so that you do not wound the lachrymal sac containing the coccyx, and that accidents happen over the judgment of the estate without its will; and then treat it with water as we have said for strong wine will heal quickly; or extend that wrapping and cleanse that pus which dries out that until near to the anus as we have said, either with a thread or with another instrument of sharp point, and then cleanse those tissues surrounding the fistula which are in the section through which you can cauterize them; and then make an effort to restore all the wound by cutting it off, and if the opening above is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the parting of the buttocks, then pus will leak out because of illness."
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	"Some fistulas are finished in this manner: when you insert the probe into the fistula, on the side of the buttocks near the surface of the body and on the edge of the anus, then take a probe with a perforated end, similar to those used for preparing hearts."
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	"Then insert the probe into that field enveloping it with five fingers or around those; and then insert the probe with forceps inside the fistula until you reach its concavity."
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	"But if you are penetrating near the edge of the anus from behind, then remove the probe from that path in such a way that you insert your little finger into the anus; and then pull out the end of the probe and adjust both ends evenly. Then tighten each one and leave it like that for one or two days. And when more tissue has been cut into the flesh, carefully remove that which is between those pieces of flesh which are between the two ends of the probe."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	"And then cure the wound until it has consolidated and healed."
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	"But if the opening of the fistula does not penetrate, then make it penetrate in whatever manner you have prepared, but do not be too eager about it because otherwise you might injure the skin. And then heal that wound."
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	"The shape of the spatula used to split open the fistula is like this: one end is very sharp and the other end is not sharp, so as not to cause unnecessary injury, as sometimes happens."
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	"For the stitching of hemorrhoids from which blood flows through the incision."
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	"Hemorrhoids come in two kinds: either they are between the buttocks resembling small coal piles, or they are like hard lumps of resin."
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	"And those that are small and large, from which blood constantly flows in one place, many of them, and some are outside the anus, and at its extremes."
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	"But those that are outside the anus are according to the months of little humidity, from which citrine water or a little blood with continuous flow comes forth, and they are according to the color of the body."
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	"And the treatment for that which is inside the anus is to command the patient to sit and squeeze until the anus opens and the hemorrhoids appear."
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	"Then you grasp them with a forceps or your nail and immediately cut them at their roots."
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	"But if the forceps cannot hold onto those because of their humidity and softness, then grasp them with rough cloth or cotton or a wool pad, squeeze them out with your fingers like that, and immediately cut them at their roots. Then sprinkle some powdered myrrh on the incision so that it may cauterize those wounds instead; or cauterize them as has been described in the chapter on cauterization."
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And then treat them with another cure until they are healed."
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	"And if the anus does not obey evacuation, then wash it with water from the anus and let it be gently evacuated when the patient squeezes."
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is slight. Take them with your nail or with forceps and cut them. Then treat them with water as mentioned earlier until they are healed."
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	"And when you have made the incision, it is necessary to stitch them closed in this way: take a thread and wrap it around a needle, then insert it into each of the wounds above. Then make the needle penetrate into the other side's root, and wrap both ends of the thread perpendicularly on the farther side from the needle. Then tightly tie the hemorrhoid with a knot, and cut off the excess thread and remove the needle."
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	"And do this to all of them, leaving one untreated so that the excess blood may flow from it."
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	"Then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or wax on the anus, and have the patient remain in bed for some time."
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And leave it alone until it has dried. Then treat it with a poultice or another cure until it is healed."
De curacio de fistulas.	"On the treatment of fistulas."
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	"Many times, a fistula may occur due to dryness or constriction by nature."
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	"And when they are old and do not respond to medicine, then you must open them with a punctum spatula or your nail so that they become moist, and remove the scabs from above which prevent them from healing. Then treat them until they have healed."
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	"Then scrape out those fistulas with a sharp point so that much blood does not flow and they are not irritated. Then treat them until they have healed."
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	"On the treatment of hemorrhoids, which is called 'clavi.'"
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	"Know that 'almesamir' is another name for hemorrhoids, and they are not always red but resemble the head of a nail in color. They occur throughout the body, especially around the buttocks and anus, where they cause pain during bowel movements."
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	"And therefore it is necessary to cut what is in the hemorrhoid's path, grasp it with forceps or fingers, and remove it from its root. Then treat it."
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	"And if you wish, cauterize them according to what has been described in its own chapter."
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	"But a 'verruca' is a small, rough, fistulous prominence on the surface of the body. Many times they appear in many children."
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	"And its treatment: stretch and cut it, or tie it with thread or hair until it dries up."
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	"If you wish, cauterize it according to what has been said, with fire or an acute medicine."
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	"And verrucae can be eradicated both inward-facing and outward-facing using the instrument that I will describe below."
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	"But 'formica' is a small, downy or fistulous prominence on the surface of the body, especially on the forehead. When it is touched, it feels like an ant bite, and they appear all over the body."
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	"To treat it: take a quill from an owl or vulture feather and make it strong. Place the quill on the 'formiga' so that its circle encompasses all sides of it. Then rotate your hand with the quill until you have incised what is around the 'formiga,' and press down on the skin's surface to remove the 'formiga' from its root."
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, do this with a copper or iron needle according to this method:"
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	"Make the tip of the needle thin, blunt (i.e. not perforated), and wrapped with wax to ensure that it slides smoothly over the skin's surface when rotated."
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	"And if you wish, cauterize the 'formiga' according to what has been mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery concerning 'athley.'"
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	"On the shape of instruments used for cautery."
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	"Sometimes cautery is performed with silver, brass, copper or iron melted and hammered. Sometimes instruments are made small or large according to the size of the patient, as those that are used for treating young children should be small; and those used on patients with round buttocks or dolorous ulcers should have small cauteries."
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	"The shape of a large and dull cautery:"
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	"The head of the needle above which the bag is tied should be wide in this manner, and it should differ from where the bag is tied as shown here:"
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	"The extremity of the pus that is within it, which has entered into the anus, should be made deaf (i.e., closed) with a gentle, subtle motion; and on one side of its entrance there should be two threads, and on the other side one thread, whose width should be according to the thickness of the rays of pus, making a smaller one for a smaller [amount of] pus."
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	"The bag in which the medications made from bladder or sheepskin are placed should have an opening of one palm's width."
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	"And it should be pierced by many threads, as it is turned; and the space between the threads should be the thickness of a finger."
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	"And then firmly insert into those threads a hot, warm cloth that has been moistened with ten parts of honey or wrapped around them; and secure it tightly with that cloth. And when the bag is placed in it, tightly close the opening of the chest between two fingers with strong pressure, and then wrap it around each thread: But note that the manner of wrapping should be such that you fill the bag with the medicine, which has been warmed according to the amount of tolerance of the patient; and make sure that it is not too hot nor too cold."
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	"And then have the patient lie on their back, elevate their buttocks and place underneath it something soft such as felt or wool; and then anoint the tip of the cautery with oil or egg albumen or fenugreek mucilage or similar substances; and then gently insert it into the anus, and then the assistant should take the bag and squeeze it two or three times vigorously until all that is in the chest has been evacuated into the bowels, and then remove the chest and have the patient bring their buttocks down to the bed."
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	"And if the medicine causes an evacuation of that kind, hold it as long as possible; and if he sleeps with it all night, it is even better for his recovery."
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	"But if you cauterize him in illnesses of retention of urine and discharge from the bladder, then you should repeat the cautery until he is healed."
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	"And if there are hemorrhoids or tender fistulas in the anus, then the cautery should be very subtle and gentle, using those cauteries with which children are cauterized."
De curacio de las plaguas.	"On the treatment of plagues."
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	"I have already spoken in the division of the treatment of plague about what was fitting for the book, and I say thus the treatment of those with my hand and medicines according to their completeness."
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	"The plague is various in accordance with what causes it and according to the location where the plague occurs."
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	"And the causes by which many times plague is brought about are thus: impact of stone, or incision with scissors or knife, or perforation with lance, or with club, or with arrow, or resembling those of many causes."
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	"But the plague that is in the parts of the body are thus: plague that falls on the head, or neck, or foot, or belly, or hip, and resembling those of the limbs."
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	"And I am recounting the treatment of some plague for which that reasoning and rule applies to other plague as well."
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	"And I will begin with simple head wounds, because the reminder of composite ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter."
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	"So I say that when a simple wound occurs in the head and it is not a fracture, then consider whether it was caused by an impact with stone or similar. If the chain has only been broken and the wound is large and you fear that apostema caut may happen afterwards, then quickly perform cephalic flebotomy and do not delay this; and remove from there as much blood according to the quantity of its virtue if no other cause prohibits flebotomy, especially if the blood issuing from the wound is little."
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	"And let flebotomy be done on the opposite side of the wounded part, and take care that the patient avoids exposure to wind and wine and coarse foods."
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	"But if you prohibit any cause due to smallness, then let the diet be reduced, and do not approach meat or wine."
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	"And if an apostema caut occurs over the wound, then cut it open and rinse with rose oil as usual or with wine in which there is styptic."
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	"But if you are sure of an apostema caut, then pause over the wound until it has its own blood and the air has not changed that powder which I will recommend later."
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	"And if the air has already changed that, then pause over the wound until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	"But if the wound is large or was caused by a cut from a sword or similar and the edges of it are not approximated by forceps, then approximate them with suture according to what I will recommend about the suture of those."
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	"But if the wound is already laid bare to bone and tendon and there is only a slight suspension, then cut that open and cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in place of the chain, and command the patient to avoid coarse foods: heads of cabbage and leeks and similar, until it is composed."
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	"And if you find putrefaction in the chain and it does not adhere to the bone, then cut away all that corruption and throw it out, and cure it."
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	"But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flow can occur and it is not cut off by medicines, then inquire about the artery, and if you find that it has not been cut, then cut it with a scalpel or ligate it; and if necessity compels you such that what we have said does not help, then cauterize until the blood is cut off."
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	"And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is light. Therefore, you powder those with this powder, so that they may be consolidated before the air changes them."
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	"And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of unripe olives one part, dragon's blood one and a half parts, quicklime three parts; let all be thoroughly pounded and sifted, and let the wound be filled with it, and let it be held by good compression until it adheres to it, and let it be coagulated with its own blood."
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	"And then compress it above with forceps and leave it alone, and do not remove it while it is like that until it becomes apostematous, because the medicine does not depart from it until it is healed."
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	"And sometimes you can do this alone with cautery when unripe olives and dragon's blood are not at hand."
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	"And this same operation is done in large wounds when it is convenient to pause over them and compress them, and these are fresh wounds with their own blood which the air has not altered."
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then this powder does not have its intended effect. Rather, cure those with what we have said: pause over those wounds with clean dressings dipped in oil or with flour paste with water and honey until corruption stops; and then cure them with other remedies until they are healed."
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	"But if a fracture of the bone occurs in the wound and it is small, then extract that with a hook."
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	"And I speak about the treatment of fractures of the head in what follows."
De las plaguas del col.	"Concerning wounds of the neck."
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	"But if a wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment between it and a simple wound of the head."
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	"But if the nerve of the neck is cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve there is nothing to be done but avoid treatment of it with anything that causes great astringency, such as verdigris and vitriol and similar substances because they harm nerves and harden it."
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	"And do not compress the wound with any hot cause because the substance of nerves is hot and their continuation is with the brain, which is the seat of all members."
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	"And if it is cured with light medicines thus: the wound washed with rosewater, sometimes infused in sweet oil or not, and turpentine when washed with rosewater, and other ointments according to this manner, humid dressings."
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	"But if the wound is large, then perform suturing or compress the lips of it, and then cure it with powders until it is healed."
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	"But if there is depth to the wound or if it occurs in the lower part where putrefaction has taken hold, then perforate it at its deepest point."
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	"But if an artery has been cut in the wound and bleeding has occurred, then separate or dry it out, ligate it, or cauterize it if necessity compels you to do so."
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the vertebrae of the neck or all have been broken and the veins of the neck are saved, then approximate the lips of the wound with sutures over the spine of the neck and do not touch it; draw them together and reduce them to their natural figure, and then compress them with a suitable splint, and leave them alone for several days; and then cure them with dressings in which there is astringency and excitement until they are healed."
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	"But if the wound has reached the bone and caused fracture there, then explore it with probes, and then if there are fragments of bone, remove all those that you can; and what cannot be removed, leave it alone until the wound has putrefied and separated, and its inflammation has been alleviated."
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	"And if the wound is fresh then powder it with the powder that I have recommended for you."
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	"But if there is a fistula in the wound, then cure it with that which is mentioned specifically in its chapter."
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	"When plague boils appear between the shoulders, they are opened with forceps or scalpel or lancet or similar tool."
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	"If it is a puncture from a lance or scalpel, sometimes its depth should be considered. Then you should examine whether the boil has wind (air) inside it when the patient exhales; then you will know that the boil is deadly."
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	"If the boil is not deep and it's fresh with its own blood, then you should pause the operation at the first hour of powdering. Do not stretch that area so that the blood is not retained in its depth and does not return to the heart and worsen the condition, but pause there with gentle attraction, and wipe it twice a day."
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	"If the ointment is not available, then you should pause at the opening of the boil's mouth to wait for it to absorb whatever humidity there may be. And make sure the patient sleeps on the boil so that what is inside can drain out."
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	"But if three or more days have passed since the boil appeared and there has been no spasm nor heart tremors nor constriction of the throat in the patient, and they show other good dispositions, then you know that the boil is safe. Then cure it with warm compresses and any other treatment until it is healed."
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	"But if the boil's healing is delayed and all this time has passed, then you know that it has already become a fistula. Cure it according to its chapter."
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	"And if the boil is caused by a cut from a razor or knife and it's simple on the surface of the skin or back, then cure it with what is preceded by stitching if it's large, or with powder if it's small."
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	"But if there is already bone involvement and some pieces have been cut off from it, then twist the boil and try to extract those pieces if they are separate."
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	"But if they are not separate, then leave them inside until the boil can be pushed out, because their extraction is eased that way."
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	"And for other accidental boils in other members, the treatment is the same as what has been said [for other kinds of boils]."
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal boils.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition that occurs in the belly is either large, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of large boils sometimes the bowel or nerve of the bowel comes out, so that there is an entrance for them and their suture should be done vigorously and carefully.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is difficult to achieve in another way, and so reducing it is also difficult, unless you quickly try to introduce it back into its own place before it opens up and becomes enlarged, because then introduction into it is difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is moderate, because in that one there is no difficulty reducing the bowel, just as there is none in the two kinds mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that suture of the belly is done in four ways, but two sutures are common and convenient for sutures of other boils on the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And the other two sutures are proper to other boils, but they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will recount each one with exposition and explanation.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the boil is small and some cause of the bowel comes out through it, and it's difficult to reduce it, then this happens in one of two ways: either because of the smallness of the disruption as said above, or when swelling has come to the bowel due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this happens, then you should cut it open in such a way that you immerse a sponge or damp cloth in water boiled alone, or water with squinant, cyperus, and spica, and embroches, so that the swelling may be resolved within the bowel.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it happens with this medicine in which there is astringency, and it's better that water alone be used for resolving the swelling.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see that the swelling has been resolved, then moisten the bowel with water in which there is altitude and mallows, because by this means entrance into it is made easier with little harm.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if entering the bowel has been prevented by this treatment, then cut open the disruption a little with an instrument that has been inserted with smegma.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it is appropriate and not necessary to cut open, so that there may be no occupation with cutting unless it is necessary and urgent.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of instruments: what shape they should have
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One end of it is cut off sharply and the other not-sharply, with a subtle point that is not too sharp like a spatula, but slightly obtuse.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the boil has become enlarged and the bowel comes out, then its reduction should be done according to its natural form, in its own place if possible on that, because it's better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is large and is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on their back, and elevate their buttocks as much as their head; but if it's in the upper part of the belly, then you should elevate the head and place the feet higher than the shoulders.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And likewise if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then always pay attention and consideration to this so that the part in which the boil is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And do this also for large boils and moderate ones.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And for small boils pause this: that you have prepared yourself, and especially make sure that the person who ministers has his hands between your armpits, holding the disruption completely with one hand and adjusting its lips, and especially uncovering it from that which should be sutured first.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common way of suturing: one in which you take a needle, or count needles according to the amount of the width of the boil; and then leave the end of the disruption from the middle finger of your left hand, and stretch the needle through one, so that you do not put thread into both ends of the cord with two threads on either side of the cord of the digits inside that part, until you have made it penetrate that part; and you already have four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then stitch with doubled thread around the needle, sometimes two parts at once, and especially join both lips and the boil by proper joining; and then leave the thickness of the finger and put another needle in that, and then tie it with thread like the first needle; and do not cease doing this if necessary until you have completed the contraction of the boil.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be moderate between thickness and subtlety because thin needles scarcely incise the flesh; but thick ones have difficult entrance into the cord, therefore they should be moderate in thickness and subtlety.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be fixed at both ends of the cord nearby because then the flesh will be scarcely incised and the boil will heal before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong suturing so that the boil may not be prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut the ends of the needles so that they do not cause discomfort while sleeping; and you will apply powdered ointments on both sides of the sutures, which will hold the ends of the needles; and leave them until you know that the boil is consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	"And this type of stitching with needles is most suitable for small wounds because it only takes one or two needles to close them."
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	"And the second type of stitching is as follows: you should administer it by suturing all four extremities (the neck and both ends of the scrotum) in one go, using a needle with thread that is fine and thin."
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	"And then, when the needle has pierced these four extremities, you should reduce the needle of that first part where you started, so that the thread pulls the skin together from the inside out, making the stitching like sewing cloth with which the skin is drawn tight."
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	"And pause between each stitch for a duration equal to the thickness of the little finger."
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	"And this stitch is known among men."
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	"And with this stitch, I sewed up the wound that had occurred in a man's belly who had been stabbed with a knife. The disruption of the wound was more than a palm wide and extended from the gut around two palms near the middle of the belly to the center of the member. And then I reduced it after 24 hours, as the gut had been forced out by the wound."
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	"And the wound was consolidated in the space of about fifteen days and he recovered and healed. And around that time, he lives for many years and returns to his former condition."
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	"And the other physicians had judged that he would not be healed. And by miracle it happened, for I did not heal him with any ointment, since there was no place where an ointment could be applied or any medicine used. Instead, I simply paused over the wound twice a day and washed it assiduously with water mixed with honey until it was healed."
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"But you should know that there are two kinds of stitches proper to narration, according to the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And it is that you begin with a running stitch, and insert the needle from the outer part towards the inner part."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And when the needle enters the bone and that muscle according to its rectitude and length of the entire body, leaving the extremity of the hip joint in which you inserted the needle; then make the needle penetrate from inside out at the other extremity of the thigh."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	"And then when you have made that penetrate, now make it penetrate again into that same extremity of the thigh from outside to inside; and leave the extremity of the hip joint that is on this side, and make the needle penetrate into the other extremity from inside to outside."
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	"And then make your penetration with that through which you made it penetrate into the hip joint at the extremity of the thigh which is on the inside."
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	"And therefore start from this side and pull that with the extremity which is of the hip joint on the other side, and extract the needle from the bone which you penetrated, and then reduce it into that bone and sew the extremity of the hip joint which is on the other side with this extremity of the thigh; and extract that from the bone which is on its part."
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	"And do this once or twice and then do it again from inside according to that example."
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	"And the sum of this manner of suture is that you should sew with silk sutures with which you sew the skin, in such a way that you sew the hip joint once from the side of the bone's extremity, and leave that other time inside until it is completed."
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	"And the second species of suture which is particularly mentioned by Galen, and this is about it and for its treatment, is that you should sew it according to semilunar form with which some doctors sew it, in such a way that they approximate all parts to their corresponding parts according to nature; and they apply the extremity of one to the other extremity of the bone, and this is done as I have recommended."
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	"See that you leave the needle in the extremity of the thigh at your disposal from the outside, and make it penetrate into the inside in that sun, and leave two extremities of the hip joint; and then turn the needle around and make it penetrate from the outside to the inside in two extremities of the hip joint."
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	"And then turn those casings around, and make each casing penetrate from the inside to the outside in two extremities of the thigh on the other side than that which is on the contrary side."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	"And this manner of suture is better than common light suture, and it is the suture of which a preceding remark was made."
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	"This is Galen's speech"
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	"And some say that abdominal suture is corrected with two needles, so that you insert into each a thread, and begin with needle insertion from where it is necessary to do so, and make it penetrate inside the other side according to the suture of those who sew the entrails evenly."
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	"And know that when rupture is in the middle of the abdomen, at that time abdominal suture is more difficult than that of other parts of the abdomen."
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	"However, the judgment of plague is judged by other plagues."
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"The cause is this: when you manage to extract the recent plague with its blood before the air alters that, and return the intestine and cover it well and prepare it properly, then pause over that powdered medicine."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"And if the air has already altered the plague, then pause over those cloths which are present there and make them dry and wring out their juices, and let them be well washed and examined; and treat it thus as is the treatment of other plagues until it is healed."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"But if you are not present, then pause over that immediately because it begins to grow warm, thickens and changes color daily as I have taught you until it is healed, for you do not need another treatment in many situations when the plague is simple."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"But if you fear that the plague might communicate to cause injury to the principal limbs, then you should immerse lion's wool in good quality olive oil or rose oil and apply it around the affected area and leave it on."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if there is pain or putrefaction in its bowels, for this often happens, then mix it with wine and black treacle, and especially if the decay has reached the bowel and is difficult to expel from within the cavity."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that that which is in the large intestine is of easier healing than that which is in the subtle intestines."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is difficult to heal because the bowel called 'gegunu' does not receive healing for any plague that falls into it; and this is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it and its size which is in those, and because of the subtlety of its body, and because of its closeness to the nature of nerves."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if that which proceeds from the plague is flesh, and you obtain it fresh, then cut it according to your skill with which you reduce swollen intestines."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if it has passed into it some time and is now green or black, then you should press it with quicklime on the location that is discolored by it, so that flows of blood may come forth, for in the flesh are veins and arteries."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And properly cut away that which is other than the limb, and hang two extreme points of the quicklime from the edge of the plague forceps, so that over you there may be alleviated the attraction of it, for then you should have discharge of the flesh and emission of the branch of the plague."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"Memorandum on Plagues when they occur in the bowel."
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When there is disruption in the bowel and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some people, for example thus: one man who had been plagued in his belly with a lance wound and the plague was on the right side of the stomach, and the plague was old and had made a fistula, but it was handled gently and with ventilation."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	"Then I pursued the cure of it although it was not yet confirmed in its healing, but I ceased to probe that which had been healed and the location was consolidated."
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	"And I put that I saw the location already consolidated, but the illness that befell him because of the mishap in his belly did not occur again; and no one was harmed by this mishap and they remained in their usual dispositions eating and drinking, and properly entered into baths and were exercised in their words."
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	"And already some experienced ones say that when plague occurs in the bowel and it is small, then it ought to be tied in this manner: namely, you should take frogs with large heads; and properly adjust the two lips of the plague and place one of those which has its mouth open over the two lips of the plague; therefore when it seizes on those and stretches its mouth, cut off its head, for it adheres and is not dissolved."
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	"And properly place another frog near the first one, and do not cease doing this with frogs one after another according to the quantity of all the plague."
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	"And properly reduce that and sew up the plague, and those attached heads remain in the bowel until the bowel is healed, and no harm befalls anyone."
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	"And it is possible that the bowel may be tied with subtle thread which is made from the gut of an attached beast, for it is more like a needle; namely you should take the extremity of these guts, and let it be well defleshed, and properly tie the extremity of it with a thread of it, wrapped around, and then insert that thread into needles and sew it up with that bowel, and reduce that in the disruption."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	"And this manner of suturing with frogs is but a way of trust and hope."
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	"But if the plague is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the subtle bowels, for then it is only subtlety, and not healing of it at all."
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	"On the cure of zuchem (fistula)"
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"You should know that every ulcer and abscess, once opened and ancient, becomes an ulcer, and is not consolidated and continually discharges pus without being cut off; then, in any limb it may be, generally it is called a fistula, which we call that same."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"A fistula in truth is a knotlike fleshy growth, hard and white, which causes no pain, having a cavity like that of the eye socket. Thus it is named that hollow ulcer or ulcer with an indentation."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And sometimes in men there is a moist ulcer which discharges pus; but when the moisture is cut off, it heals in some hours."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"Sometimes this moisture is thick and scanty, copious and thin."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already said in the division, when I discussed ulcers, that every ulcer which does not heal or is not on bare flesh, happens due to one of these nine causes: either due to lack of blood in the body, or due to malice of the ulcer, or because there is hard cartilage between the ulcer and its lips preventing the growth of new tissue, or because it has too much skin overlying it, or because the ulcer itself becomes putrid and the material transmitted to it is of poor quality, or because the treatment being used is inappropriate for that ulcer, or because corruption occurs in the region and there is pestilence, or due to the nature of the region, as happens in Saragossa, where difficult digestion of diseases occurs and healing of ulcers is delayed by nature, or because a bone or many bones are present within the ulcer."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already explained all these causes, their signs and their treatments with medicines in the division."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And so I want to tell you about the treatment of fistula, which is performed through an operation using a knife."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And you should know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body; for some are related to large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the bladder, or the bowel, or the urinary bladder, or to one of the ribs, or to one of the vertebrae of the spine, or to one of the joints composed by composition such as that of the hand and foot. And some are close to the main member and similar ones."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And therefore those fistulas which are of this kind have difficult healing and do not receive treatment, and dealing with them is a matter of trial and error and ignorance."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if there is one of these fistulas whose depth does not reach any of the places I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its healing, and you want to know its extent, then take a probe of silk or iron, and if the fistula goes straight ahead, insert it into it."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate it with a probe of thin lead, because lead due to its weight follows the curvature of its course."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula has many horrifying branches, it is not possible for you to mark them with a probe."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Then cleanse the openings for their openings, for the moisture used to cleanse that one will go towards the others and cause them to flow."
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Translation:
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And once you have stood on all those causes with true steadfastness, then proceed to the treatment according to your confidence: and it is that you consider now whether the fistula is apparent near or in a safe place, far from joint, nerve, artery, vein, or any of the places which yield to you and are spoken of."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Now you dry the fistula according to what is said before about its nature, and remove that which is in that filtration and of corrupted flesh, and that which is born in the opening of the flesh or of skin and similar, and cure it inside until it is healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of great depth and is according to rectitude, then it is necessary that you insert that into the perineum as far as it will be possible for you, and appropriately cleanse that of all its corrupted flesh; and appropriately administer hot cloths wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce those inside the concavity of the fistula, which you have comprehended with iron."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this many times inside until the sharp medicine corrodes all that is rough in the concavity of the fistula from corruption."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"And appropriately restore it with ointments which generate healthy flesh inside until it is healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	"But if it is not healed by that, then you cauterize it according to what we have recommended."
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	"But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you should be certain about it, then you incise it and dry it according to what we have recommended, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as thus we have said."
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is exposed and is in no corruption or blackness, then you scrape that inside until all corruption is removed; and appropriately cure it with that which causes flesh to grow inside until it is healed."
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	"And if it is not healed and continues to throw out pus as before, then know that you have not reached the total eradication of corruption; and therefore you uncover it carefully again and meticulously make the cause of it clear and cleanse it with the final cautery of your choice, and appropriately restore it."
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	"And therefore if it is healed, good; but if not, then know that that corruption is in the distant depth of the body which has not been reached, and therefore there is nothing else to do but leave it."
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	"And if the corrupted bone is small or can be removed, then you remove it with subtle forceps which are suitable for that."
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	"But if there are large bones, then meticulously perform the extraction of all those, and leave none behind without your cautery."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	"But if you encounter any difficulty in the incision of the humidity and there is no fear or mistake in their incision, then cut those ligaments or flesh which are here, and cleanse the bones."
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	"But if you have not prepared to remove the bones at your discretion, then pause over the wound that produces the wound and leave it alone until that is around those bones of flesh and ligaments, and guard the wound so that it does not consolidate but rather be constrained by the section which you have incised in your operation."
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	"Wait, if you fear it, pause over the wound submerged in threefold oil, or wound submerged in Egyptian pitch, or in one of the green ointments, for when those ligaments dry up and the bones are separated from their attachment, then attraction is eased."
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	"But if it is a large bone such as the thighbone or shinbone or similar ones, and what of it is corrupted is only its surface, then scrape that alone with a curette until that blackness and corruption are removed, and appropriately restore the wound."
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	"But if what of it is corrupted is a large part and the corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and incise there where the corruption has reached, and therefore cure it until it is consolidated."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	"And I advise you that which befell a man in his thigh for which he paused and had helpers on your operation."
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	"A young man around 30 years old happened to have pain in his thigh, and it was on the inner side of the thigh where there was matter inside the body which had reached the thigh, and it was a case of an abscess with a large abscess, and not from any external cause."
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.
