"And therefore the time was extended with that because of the error of doctors until the abscess burst and there was much matter flowing out, and its cure was appropriately paused until the thigh became fistulated, and many orifices were made in it which all flowed pus and humidity of the body."
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	"And therefore he consulted many doctors for about two years, and there was no knowledge among them but in the art of it until I was called."
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	"And when I saw his thigh and the matter that flowed from those orifices through a large body, the whole body of that man was already stiffened and his color was yellowish."
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	"And therefore I inserted a tent into one of those orifices and reached the bone with it."
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	"And appropriately I searched and examined all the orifices and found that they had come from all parts of the thigh."
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	"And therefore I took courage and incised over one of those orifices until I discovered a part of the bone which was rotten, and I removed that corrupted part which was earthy and rotting and blackened; and already a part of the thigh had been corrupted where it had penetrated into the muscle."
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	"And therefore I covered what had been discovered and prepared by me of the bone that was laid bare."
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	"I judged it not to be in the bone but only that corruption which I had cut off and covered, and I had already decided."
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	"And therefore I paused the restoration of the wound with medicinal consolidatives for a long time, but it did not consolidate."
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	"And therefore I reopened and discovered over the bone again following the first discovery, and I found continuous corruption with the bone."
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	"And covered what seemed to me of that corruption, and therefore I continued the cure and restoration appropriately, but it was not restored."
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	"And therefore I discovered again over it the third time and did not cease to incise little by little particularly on the bone until about a palm of it was incised, and that extracted with its marrow, and appropriately restored it with medicines, and it consolidated easily and healed."
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	"It is not necessary to repeat the operation and section of it except for the disposition of his weakness and for the poverty of his tolerance and fear of death in him, because he was always depressed because of excessive evacuation with syncope."
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	"And therefore it was healed by entire healing, and nothing remained in place of hard bone or flesh; and his disposition in his body was good and he returned to his strength; and he changed his habits and did not do anything contrary to walking nor any harm in any cause."
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	"But if the bone is prominent in place of the body, then it is necessary that you cut it according to this manner: and that you take linen and stretch it over the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone else to extend it on his side; and pause that first linen with another thicker linen; and appropriate cover it over the flesh that is below the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh towards its sides, and uncover the flesh over the place where you want to saw in order for the saw not to touch the flesh."
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	"And place a cloth or table beneath the bones decently, for when you do this, it does not hinder the saw from cutting rotten flesh."
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	"And ensure that the sawing is done gradually on the rotten spot, for if it is in the concave part of the bone and does not appear on its surface to touch, then it must be sawn from another side."
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	"And if the bone is rotten and does not stand out, then one continuous piece is made with another, and the corruption is in the middle part or in a part of it. Therefore you uncover all the flesh from every side; and then place a cloth beneath, and saw that of the first part where there is corruption, so that the sawing may be continued on the other part."
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	"And saw according to the location of the corruption, a little bit at a time, as we have said."
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	"And if the corruption is at the joint, then cut into that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it continues from the other part."
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	"But if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not a matter for cutting but rather for treatment."
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	"And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is very difficult. However, you must inquire into the corruption and find out how it appears to you, and then abrade that area and clean it according to each disposition that is possible for you, and with each remedy make sure that you do not harm any vein or nerve."
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And know that incising tools and saws for incising these bones are very different according to the situation of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, smallness, hardness, and rarity. Therefore, you must prepare suitable instruments for each type of operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"And know that this operation indicates to you the type of instrument that you will need. When you have great knowledge and long experience in the ways of this art, and are familiar with the symptoms of illnesses, then you already know what is suitable for each instrument for every illness."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And here at the end of this chapter, I give you the number of instruments that you will use simply with which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experience on others."
Forma de serra:	"Shape of saw:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Form of another saw:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Form of another saw:"
Forma de autra serra gran:	"Form of another large saw:"
Forma de ray:	"Form of a rasp:"
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	"The head of this rasp should be in the shape of a star-pointed key head, and its points should be in the shape of alstar points."
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	"And it is not sufficient that with this rasp you rub the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or if the mouth is large and wide."
Forma de razori major dels autres:	"Form of the larger razor compared to others:"
Forma de razori menor:	"Form of a smaller razor:"
Forma de razori lat:	"Form of a broad razor:"
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	"Form of another saw suitably made: let it be arched as high as possible and sharp like iron, and its side blades should be suitably made like a descending punch."
Forma de lu:	"Form of it:"
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	"Form of razor with concavity:"
Forma de razori autra subtil:	"Form of another fine razor:"
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	"Form of another razor with curved tip:"
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	"Form of a small rasp resembling an awl:"
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	"Form of the incising tool with which bones are incised:"
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	"Form of another smaller incising tool:"
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	"Form of yet another incising tool: this one is similar to a rasp, and its tip is like a saw. It is used in many places on the bones."
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	"Form of the rasp which is suitable for the ratio of that which is perforated by the bones:"
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	"And its tip is triangular and has a sharp point."
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	"And it is made of Indian steel, and similarly all the causes that we have mentioned regarding razors, incising tools, and saws."
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"Of bone cutting and sawing."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	"Extremities can be shortened either due to an intrinsic cause or an extrinsic cause. This may happen because you have treated the corruption with medicines and yet there is no improvement. Sometimes, the corruption may spread to other members without any apparent cause. In such cases, it is necessary that you incise that member where the corruption occurs so that the illness can be alleviated from death or malice, which is a greater damage to the member."
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	"And the sign of this is that the member becomes black where it has been burned, even though no fire was there. Or, putrefaction approaches with blackening within which corruption occurs and extends throughout the entire body; therefore, you should incise that one."
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	"And similarly, if corruption is due to the bite of some venomous cause such as that of a scorpion, mare's tail, viper, or similar ones."
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	"And if the corruption or bite is at the tip of the finger, then you should incise the finger and not allow the corruption to spread to the hand."
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	"And similarly, if it extends to the hand, then you should incise that one from the wrist joint so that corruption does not spread to the arm."
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	"And if it goes further than this, then you should incise the arm at the elbow joint."
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"And if corruption passes beyond this and even reaches near the elbow joint, then it is the death of the illness. Administering another cause for cure at that point requires a larger amount of virtue."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And similarly, if corruption extends to the toe of the foot, then you should incise that one at one of its joints."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"And if it reaches the heel, then you should amputate all of the foot."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	"But if it can reach the ankle, then you should incise the calf at the ankle joint."
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	"And if corruption has already reached the ankle, then there is nothing else to be done except to abandon it to death."
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	"The manner of incising the member or sawing it is to stretch the ligaments at the farthest part where you wish to incise, and stretch another ligament above that place. Then extend one ligament at each end and another on top. Separate the flesh between two ligaments using a broad spatula until all the flesh is exposed, then incise or saw it."
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	"And it is necessary that cloth of linen be placed at all parts so that the place may not touch it, and that the illness receives proper injury and cauterization."
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	"But if bleeding occurs while working, then you should cauterize the place carefully or apply some powders that restrain blood. Then return to your treatment until it is completed."
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And then bind the member with ligaments as appropriate and cure it until it heals."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	"I also recommend to you what happened to a man in his foot. This one had the accident which I and you are recommending, which is the fourth one: blackness occurred in his foot with scorching that was similar to fireburn."
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	"And this corruption first appeared at his toe which then spread throughout his entire foot."
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	"And then that man decided to amputate his foot himself because the corruption was advancing with great force and pain. He incised his foot at the ankle joint, and it healed."
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	"For a long time that same corruption occurred to him in the index finger of his hand."
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	"And then it came to me and that same superfluity persecuted him with what I had put on his hand for the treatment of his wound. And so the superfluity did not recede, but began to spread to another finger until it reached his hand."
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	"And he called me to incise his hand, but I did not wish to do so hoping for improvement from that excess, and more than anything I feared the incision of his hand leading to death, for the power of the illness was great."
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	"And since he persisted with me, he returned to his land and eventually heard that that man prepared and incised his entire hand, and was healed."
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	"And I do not recount this narrative except to serve as a reminder about that which falls under this illness, and what sign it signifies and according to which sign it is operated."
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	"The treatment of sinus problems and the quality of cleansing with medications."
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	"When an abscess occurs in certain flesh members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it collects pus, and then it ruptures and perforates, and the pus comes out, leaving the place empty like a vessel, and the cord that remains above it is like a thin cloth, and there has been no further corruption, and it does not impress upon the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula."
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	"But if the space is prolonged until corruption impresses upon some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus."
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	"And the treatment of it is that you incise that cord completely as it revolves, and especially when it is thinned out and made like cloth, making sure that it does not adhere to the place due to its corruption."
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	"But if you hope that the cord will adhere and that that corruption has not yet reached its end, and there is an opening in the cord on the surface, then you treat it with a clyster."
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	"And if you consider the sinus, then if it is large and the arm that goes into it has a foul odor, then you cleans it with the Egyptian medicament which is made of oil, vinegar, and cinammon received in equal parts, put together in a vessel, and cooked over the fire until it reaches the consistency of honey."
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	"And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey, and cleans the sinus with that, and strengthen the opening of it, leaving the medicine in it for a period of two hours."
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	"And then extract it with precision, and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pus is removed."
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	"And sometimes it is cleaned with water of ashes when this medicament is not present. And if you take the ash of vine wood and put it on the water, then boil it and cleanse that with it until you are sure that the sinus has opened."
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	"And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicament or the water of ashes, then cleanse it with water and honey mixed together in equal parts, and also use wine and honey mixed together, for the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when there is an excess of astringency and dryness in the wine."
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	"And when you do this several times and are sure that the sinus has been removed, then cleanse it with something that causes flesh to grow in it."
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	"And if you take some refined diaphoretic ointment and dissolve it with rose oil and astingent wine, or use some other medicines and ointments that have the properties that I have already written about in the treatise on ointments."
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	"And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and the cannula of the clyster cannot be received into it, then widen it gradually with a small file, pausing in it with hot water wrapped in Egyptian or basilicon ointment until it has been widened."
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	"And similarly if the opening is wide, then bring together the lips of it with stitches and leave in it the quantity that intervenes between the clyster without addition."
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	"And if the opening of the sinus from which the arm emerges is raised up on its sides, then dry it with pus in a place that is low down so that the arm may run freely within it, for when the arm is compressed by the pressure of the sinus, flesh will be generated there."
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	"And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus in the area of the pus as you wish, then prepare the member with preparation so that the arm runs freely through it according to what pleases you and without any cause of retention remaining in it."
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	"And take consolidating medicines that are applied to the sinus appropriately, with whatever you wish extended over them on linen cloth."
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	"And let the linen be of such a size that it covers all of the sinus; and then cut with forceps on the right side of the opening of the sinus a slit somewhat wider than the opening of the sinus, and then extend over another piece of linen some ointments according to the quantity of the slit, and apply it above it at a distance from the opening of the sinus so that the exit of the arm from it may be alleviated and the linen not remain for too long, only for a few days once."
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	"But remove that which is on the opening of the sinus at every hour so that what has adhered to it may be discharged from the arm."
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	"And so that you may know whether what flows out of the arm is much or little, whether it is digested or undigested."
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	"And now you shall consider the place of that joint, whether in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is inflamed."
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	"And when your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter which is cast upon the opening of the joint has already adhered or nearly adheres, then on the third day, carefully detach it; but when you detach it, immediately change the bandage for another one and renew the ointment."
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	"But if from the joint a rather long space has yawned with subtle virus, then do not despair of its adhesion, for the healing of it is nearly accomplished; for there are some men in whom the generation of flesh in their bandages is tardy, and of those some in whom the contrary takes place."
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	"And if from the joint more than ten days has issued thick pus, then you know that the joint does not adhere; and if there is tardiness in the adhesion of the joint and this is the cause prolonged, then you shall adapt medicines for drying; but if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they shall be made dry thus with fine ointment."
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	"And the last thing with which you shall cure it is to take some fine ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and let there be placed upon it old wine vinegar in its substance; and thus apply that ointment with it, and use it."
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	"And it seems that in this action when there is no pus, fine ointment should be used with honey, when it is cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or else take myrrh and aloe and sesame, and grind all together and powder upon the honey while it is on the fire, and then strain that upon a cloth and apply it to the joint; and sprinkle that with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and powder it upon the cloth."
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"And sometimes it is administered with long pepper and the roots of celestial lilies (and that is celestial lily) and barley flour and centaurea, and use these simples or adjust them, grind them and sift them and powder upon the honey which has been prepared; and use it."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"And if the joint is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, then you know that there is corruption in its premise, and therefore make an examination of the bones or of the other hard members or of the ligaments; then you shall treat it with fistula cure, as has been said above."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"On the treatment of pimples, rubbed-on ointments, nail-cutting and adding a finger and cutting."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	"A pimple is an abscess that arises from beneath the nail of the finger or toe of the hand or foot; it commonly occurs on other fingers and when prolonged its treatment is less valued; otherwise it is an apostema of cauterized apostema, or corrupted, and pus emerges from it which corrodes the root of the nail, often corrupting all of it entirely, and it sometimes extends its corruption to the bone so that there is a foul odor and the tip of the finger becomes reddened, and its color becomes dark."
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	"And therefore when you have done what we said in the division and your treatment does not relieve it, then it is necessary that you incise with iron all of the superfluity that remains of the nail, and immediately cauterize the wound with that, for cautery is greatly beneficial in this."
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and yet the edges of the nail begin to cut into the flesh within, and it starts to prick and cause pain there, then you must make a subtle incision from the angle of the nail that pricks the flesh, and push it out and incise that flesh easily, and place upon what remains of the flesh medicines that corrode and consume everything; and then apply ointment until it is healed."
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	"But if corruption has already entered the bone, then you must incise and extract that bone, for it is never healed when the bone is corrupted."
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if sometimes corrosion and corruption go into the finger, then you must incise that in one of its joints according to how it has spread, and then apply treatment until it is healed."
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	"But if the nail has received percussion or injury and there is intense pain in that place, then at first you must bleed the malady, and then dry the nail with a sharp spatula using a transverse cut from above to below, being careful that the cut does not extend into the flesh beneath the nail; otherwise you will cause intense pain and stimulate the birth of superfluous flesh in that place; then treat that place with something that alleviates pain."
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	"But what is said above, which is born in most men, is usually entirely fleshy, and often on the bones or often on the nail."
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	"And some are born at the root of the joint, or their birthplace is in some joints of the fingers."
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"But that which is born in one of the joints of the finger is not painful; and that which is born at the joint is often painful."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And those that are born fleshy, the incision will be easy; and it is necessary that you incise it close to its root with a broad spatula."
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	"But that which is born at the root of the joint is difficult to treat; therefore beware of its excision."
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"But in that which is born in the finger between the joints, it is necessary at first to incise the flesh of it with a round incision down to the bone, and then saw through it with one of those suitable saws fitted for that purpose, and then treat it until it is healed."
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	"But consolidation which occurs in the fingers between their many joints or through birth defects of man born thus, or from injury or burning by fire, or from contusion, then it is necessary to remove that consolidation until those digits return to their natural form."
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	"And then place between their wrappings of them hot oil-soaked wool so that they are not easily consolidated; and separate those or place between them a thin sheet of lead until it is consolidated as necessary."
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	"And similarly if consolidation occurs in some digits with the palm, then you must remove that consolidation according to how it is prepared and suitable for the shape of the limb."
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	"Of incisions of veins, there are many."
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	"Veins are many, and they are large veins wrapped around thickly full of blackish superfluity which come into prominence in the limbs of the body, and their most frequent occurrence is in the legs, especially in those of travelers, workers, and carriers."
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	"Therefore you must administer a purge to the body of black bile several times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein."
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	"But the treatment of them with iron is according to two methods: one is that they should be incised and that black blood drawn out; the other method is that the vein should be raised up and all extracted."
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	"The section of it is according to this method: first, incise the thigh with cold water at its beginning until thick blood is resolved, which is the sediment of the thigh; then bind the thigh of the sick person to the superior part of the hip joint up to the lower part of the knee with a bandage; then cut through the vein in one place, or two, or three with an ample incision; then raise black blood with the index finger at the lower part of the thigh upward and downward until as much blood as you wish and deems sufficient has been removed."
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	"And then bind that [the bandage/wound], and instruct them to abstain from foods generating black bile."
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	"And perform the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full, as is known to the patient."
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	"Here is how the elevation of their legs should be done: you who raise the patient's leg, if it moves easily, and then place it in a warm bath, immerse the leg's bandage with cold water until it reddens and veins become prominent; or let them exercise vigorously, if there is no bath nearby, until that member becomes scarlet."
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	"And then cut the cord on the right side of the vein, either at its length or at its end, and then remove it, or else cut it below where the foot is."
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	"And then tie off the cord with forceps and remove the vein from all parts until it appears visible to sensation. And it is necessary for one who knows that wound to decline towards blackness."
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	"And afterwards, with evacuation having ceased, tie off that white which was like a cord."
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	"Then place that rope within so it may be elevated and cast off from the chain, and suspend it with a hook."
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	"Furthermore, cut open that section for three days, and then remove the chain from the part above the vein where it appears."
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	"Then elevate it and cut that section on the other side near the stalk; then extract it and elevate it so it may be passed through the second section; and then extract it from the section above."
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	"And do this so that you may extract it from the section which is placed underneath or above all sections, so that all may be removed; and then cut it."
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	"And if you cannot extract and elevate it, then insert a doubled needle with thread and tie that off and extract the chain, or insert it within the rope and twist it all around in whatever way."
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	"And be sure that it is not cut; for if it is broken, it will make it difficult to elevate the person and cause harm due to that injury."
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And once all has been extracted, then pause upon the place of the wounded lane submerged in wine and both rose oil and non-rose oil, and care for it until it is healed."
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	"And if the vein is contracted with tortuosity that cannot be straightened out as we have said, then you must cut through all the parts of the twist and the locations where it is wrapped around; and also suspend it with hooks so that you may elevate it entirely."
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	"And be sure to guard your section so that you do not cut the vein and cause harm to it, for it will be difficult to elevate if it is harmed. Use your caution in this."
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	"Form of the incident with which a vein is severed:"
Forma de unci orp:	"Shape of a hook or clamp:"
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	"It is not sharp like hooks and does not have a pointed extremity so that it may not harm the vein. It is of thick flexibility in its lion part; for if it were thin, it would cut the vein due to its thinness; having surplus thickness as we have said."
De extraccio venae cruris.	"Of the extraction of the vein of the thigh."
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	"This vein is generated in the chambers in tawny lands such as Al-Aqaba in Arabic lands and in dry lands of India with little tenderness where there is neither grass nor herb."
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	"And it is also generated in other parts of the body besides the chambers."
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	"Thus, the condition of this one is due to putrefaction that comes from leaving the intestines as if they were venomous serpents and worms generating between the intestines and the flesh."
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	"The sign of the onset of this condition is from this vein that appears in the inflamed chamber; and near the location it is congested, and near there begins the vein to emerge from the site of that congestion which resembles a plant root."
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	"Then, when the extremity appears, at that time you should wrap around it one piece of lead weighing as much as two dragons, and then tie it and leave the lead suspended from the chamber."
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	"So many times when something goes outwards due to this condition, you should wrap that in lead and tie it up."
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	"And if it does not prolong itself, then you should cut off a part of it and wrap the remaining portion; but do not cut it from the root, for if you cut that it will contract and enter into the flesh and cause an abscess and putrefaction in the location with a bad ulceration."
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	"So that it may be drawn out gradually and extracted little by little, until the last of it is pulled out and none of it remains in the body."
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	"And from this vein, some men have said that it is as long as two and twenty palms, but I have seen one which was thirty."
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	"And if it is cut in the time of its treatment, then insert a tube into the wound and pierce that with a long tube into the body until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefying medicines to the location for some days; and afterwards treat it with the cure for apostumes."
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	"And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the junction of the foot or in the foot itself, and comes from many openings; and it is said that each opening sends forth one branch."
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	"And thus treat it as we have said in the division above, with what has been mentioned previously."
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	"Concerning cutting for worms generated under the skin, and is called bovine illness."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	"This illness is called in some lands 'bovine disease' because often it occurs in oxen and there is one worm which is born between the backbone and the flesh, and it goes throughout the body pushing and pulling itself along until it tears apart the backbone and comes out."
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	"And its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, just as happens with worms, serpents, earthworms, and roundworms in the belly."
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	"And it is feared on account of its malice, for when it goes into the body and rises up to the head, and reaches the brain, then often it breaks open there and enters in and destroys the brain, which happens many times."
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	"And therefore when you wish to treat it and extract it, first determine its course and appearance by feeling. Then constrain with something that is above it and something that is below it with pressure and binding, and then dry around it and extract it."
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if it is caught in the flesh and not removed, then apply a caustic with fire to the location where it resides until it dies. The greatest cause that is feared is corruption of it, by which it corrupts the location as has been said."
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	"But if you wish that one who has come near the head to be removed from there, then constrain over the eyebrow with strong binding, and dry around it, and extract it. And let the patient use medicines to purify his body by evacuating bad putrid humors, and avoid foods that cause putrefaction."
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	"Concerning cutting for the illness called 'nafir'."
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	"This illness is called in our land 'nafir', and it is pain that comes to certain limbs, and also moves from limb to limb."
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	"And I have already seen that one as I will tell you about it."
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	"I was summoned to a sick woman in a village. Upon exposing her arm, I saw a small inflammation on the vein of the forearm. After an hour had passed, I observed that inflammation spreading thus: it appeared as if it were alive and moved from place to place, but more slowly than porphyry."
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	"Then the pain went away from that spot and fixed itself in the muscle. It stayed there for about an hour."
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	"And then it moved to the other side of her body, reaching her other arm."
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	"And I saw that it was moving around her entire body, changing places rapidly from member to member. It was truly remarkable."
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	"I had seen something like this before in my practice, though I had rarely heard of pain being transferred from member to member."
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	"But I have never seen anything like this in the hospitals as I did with this woman."
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	"And I thought that it was because the woman was elderly, with dry skin and visible veins, which made the movement of this wind-like sensation more apparent."
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	"And it is necessary that this condition does not appear in those who are delicate and have humid bodies with hidden veins."
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	"And when you wish to treat it, if the patient feels pain, then after an hour or two has passed without any apparent sign at the hospital as we have said, then press upon that spot lightly and gently until the restricted wind-like sensation has been released, and cauterize the location."
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	"But if you do not see it at your hospitals, then treat it with exercise of the body and whatever expels wind. Use pills made from fetid herbs and pills containing serpentaria and similar substances."
De extraccio de sagetas.	"On arrow extraction."
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	"Arrows are varied according to species and according to the parts of the body where they strike. Their variety is such that some have large points, others small, concave, or blunt, which are solid. Others have three edges, while yet others have tongues; still others are star-shaped."
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	"And those that are according to limbs and parts where they strike follow two methods: for the limbs or principal members cause death directly, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and their like. Therefore, when struck in one of these members and signs of death appear, which I will recount later, it is then necessary to avoid removing that arrow in those where death would ensue from removal in the best of conditions. But if such signs do not appear, nor is the arrow hidden deep within the member, then you may remove it and treat the wound."
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	"And signs of brain injury include when struck by an arrow which pierces the bone and exits through the fontanel above the brain. This causes sudden loss of consciousness, darkness of vision, vertigo, heat in the eyes, inflammation and heat of the tongue, spasms and confusion of intellect, vomiting of bile, difficulty speaking and loss of voice, and there appears from the wound white fluid like dust, and watery discharge like the moisture of flesh."
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	"And therefore, if such signs appear to you, then you should abstain from treating and removing the arrow unless it is outside."
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	"But signs of an arrow having struck the heart include: it is near the left nipple and feels firm where it has lodged, not hollow; there is a strong sensation like the beating of the pulse, and black blood flows from the wound. Death ensues suddenly without delay."
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	"And signs that an arrow has struck the lung include: frothy blood issues from the wound, vessels near the throat are suffocated, and the patient's complexion changes. He exhales much breath rapidly or sighs for air."
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	"And if the arrow strikes the pleura which is in the chest, there is pain near the little ribs. Breathing becomes difficult with violent pain and sighing, and the muscles of all members are not moved."
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	"And if the arrow strikes the stomach, thereupon much undigested food issues from the wound."
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	"And if the arrow strikes the abdomen and becomes lodged there, thereupon some opening of the wound appears, or the skin is torn, or an intestine is ruptured. There is no hope in treating the removal of the arrow."
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	"And if the arrow strikes the bladder and urine is expelled from outside, and thereupon some part of the wound appears externally. There is strong pain over the wound, therefore know that it is mortal."
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	"But the other members such as face, neck, throat, shoulders, arms, shoulder blades, spine, collarbone, hip bone, and leg, and their counterparts of the limbs are saved according to their natural positions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not poisoned."
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	"And I will tell you what I have seen concerning these arrows, so that you may know how to treat them."
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	"It happened that an arrow struck the tear duct of the eye in one person's nose. I removed it from another opening near his ear, and he was healed without damage to his eye."
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	"And I removed another arrow from a Jew which had struck him in the socket of his eye. I left the eyelid closed and then opened it gradually until at last the arrow was exposed, but only a small part of its tip remained attached to its shaft. It was one of those sharp arrows used by the Turks, with a lion-head point and without feathers."
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	"And the Jew recovered, suffering no damage to his eye."
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	I extracted another arrow from a man named Crestian, which had fallen into his thigh, an Arab arrow it was, and it's that one with its ears; then I incised him between two tendons, for it was submerged in his thigh; then I gently removed that one, and Crestian is healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	I extracted another arrow from a man which had fallen into his belly, and I thought he would die from it; and since thirty days have passed and there is no change in his condition, I incised over the arrow and removed it, and he is healed, and no bad accident happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	I saw another man in whom an arrow had stuck in his back, and the wound was consolidated there; since it was necessary to remove the arrow from the middle of the flesh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I saw a woman in whom an arrow had stuck in her belly, and the wound was consolidated inside her, and she did not change in any of her bodily functions, nor did she suffer harm from it in any way.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	I saw another man in whom an arrow had stuck in his face and the wound was consolidated but the arrowhead remained, without causing much pain, and many others appeared like these.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	I extracted the arrow from one of the king's princes who had it stuck in the middle of his nose and was already inclining towards the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to treat him about three days after the arrow had entered.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the wound of the arrow very narrow; and then I probed it carefully with a probe, but did not find anything; but he felt pricking from behind the right ear, so I thought that that pricking was caused by the point of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I widened the place with an emollient plaster which has attractive and digestive virtues, being confident that the place would be opened up so that I could see the place where the arrow was, in order to extract it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And there did not happen in the place any accidental sign that the arrow had reached that place; and I continued with the plaster on it for many days, and nothing accidental happened. And the wound became consolidated meanwhile, and the illness from extracting it lasted for many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and told me about it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I put on the wound an acute corrosive medicine for many days until it was opened up, and with a probe I explored there and found the point of the arrow subtly adhered to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And immediately afterwards I adjusted the application of that acute medicine on the wound until the point of the arrow appeared visibly to me, and it took me more than four months to do this.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound was enlarged enough so that I could introduce forceps into it, and did not close up again afterwards, then I did not stop probing and devising about it with various methods of engineering until one day I began to extract it using forceps made specifically for this purpose, as described at the end of this chapter, until I extracted it; and immediately afterwards I dressed that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I restored it and the wound became consolidated, and the illness was completely healed without any remainder.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I tell you the quality of extracting some arrows, so that you may understand better what I have not described here, for the parts of this art and the definitions of it are not understood through narration nor can they be comprehended from this book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise craftsman compares little with much; and about what is present he speaks more than about what is absent; and he finds new operation and new instrument according to the descent of foreign causes of the art when they happen.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not thrown out of the members in which they are stuck except by two means: either by attraction of the place where it entered, or by the opposite part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is thrown out by the place where it entered, either is an arrow proceeding in a fleshy location, and is attracted and expelled.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not happen immediately upon being struck, then you should leave it for some days until the flesh that is around it swells up and the attraction of it and its exit are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if it is stuck in bone and does not come out immediately, then leave it for some days and stir it daily with attraction and motion, and soon it will be expelled.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not come out even after several days, then you should bore around the arrow in that bone with a subtle awl until the location is widened by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those accidents appear which I have mentioned earlier, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it there until its owner's condition is equalized for a few days; for if the arrow pierces the cerebrum, then death cannot be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is stuck only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the cerebrum, and the illness lasts for several days without any cause of those accidents occurring, then you should devise methods to attract the arrow and attract it out.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is deeply stuck and will not come out, then you should administer awls around the arrow as we have described, and afterwards dress the location until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already hidden in the location of the body and is hidden from sensation, then you should search for it with a probe, and if you find it, then attract it out with some instruments which are suitable for its attraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it because of the contraction of the wound and the length of the point, and here there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein, then you should operate on the wound until it is widened and it becomes possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is held by the ears with which it is gripped, then you should loosen the flesh in which it is stuck on all sides with whatever engineering you can devise; and devise how to achieve this, if not by means of the escape of the flesh through the fracture of the ears or twisting of them until it comes out.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.
