And when you are administering the extraction of the arrow in any location, then use your hand twisted with forceps on all sides so that it can achieve its objective; and be very subtle about this so that the arrow is not broken and it is done easily for you both in attracting it out and extracting it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot reach it at that time, then leave it for some days until the parts around it have recovered, and afterwards try again; for now it will be easier.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if you experience counterflow of blood, then administer what we have said about treatment in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your power of incision of vein or nerve or cord, and administer whatever engineering you can think of for the escape of the arrow; and do this with facility and calmness and slowness and steadfastness as I and you have recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And ensure that you compress the arrow so that the illness follows its natural course according to the figure which the arrow was supposed to follow in it, for this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	"But if this is not possible for you, then you shall perform what is possible according to your knowledge."
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	"But the arrows that are shot from the other side of the target, or those for which no partition has yet begun to be made in the partitions of the other side, or those whose extreme tip is felt in the partition above the nearest prop, you shall cut across it; and make your section according to the quantity in which the forceps take hold; and then throw that one away, as it is too light to use."
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	"But if it is retained in the bone, then you shall twist the arrow according to its direction of entry into the bone, and extract it little by little, bit by bit."
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	"And if not, leave that one alone for a few days, and then remove it when it has begun to rot."
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	"And if the shaft of the arrow is in there too, then you shall pull it out with it."
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	"But if the shaft has broken off and you wish to administer traction, then insert a probe there, if it is not too short; curve it concavewards so that its concavity fits over the end of the arrow, and then pull it out."
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	"But if the arrow is concave, then you shall pull it out with a probe entering into that curve, for the arrow will be lightened by that."
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	"And if the arrowhead is barbed, then you must cut away all the flesh in which it is embedded, if that be possible for you; and then dress the wound with whatever seems suitable."
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And if the arrow has entered the bone, or the belly, or the bladder, or the flank, and is close enough for you to touch it with your hand, and it is possible for you to cut upon it, then cut thereupon and guard against injury to a vein or nerve; extract the arrow and sew up the wound if necessary, and dress it until healed."
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	"Forms of forceps with which arrows are extracted:"
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	"The ends of them are shaped like the beak of a bird, and they have teeth like a saw when they grasp the arrow, so that it is not allowed to slip away."
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	"And they come in many different shapes, large and small, few or numerous according to the size of the arrowhead and its thickness, and the width of the wound and the closeness of its contraction."
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	"Form of concave probe, shaped like the quill of a bird, to facilitate entry into the wound caused by an arrow and traction upon it when it is short:"
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	"Form of probe for extracting barbed arrows:"
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	"like a hook, to facilitate entry into the wound in a concave arrow and its extraction with it."
De fleubotomia de las venas.	"On phlebotomy of veins:"
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	"The veins commonly used for phlebotomy are thirty in number, of which sixteen are in the head. These include two pulsating veins near the ears, called helixes; two herbs that appear on both temples; two veins located in the lacrimal ducts of both eyes, called aspiciences; a prepared vein in the middle of the forehead; and a vein at the tip of the nose; two jugulars at the neck; two veins on the upper lip; two veins on the lower lip; two veins that are called algels; and two veins below the tongue."
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	"But the veins that are commonly opened in the arms are five in number: of these one is cephalic, and it lies on the outer side; the people call it 'the vein of the head'. Another is median, composed of a branch of the basilica and another of the cephalic; the people name it 'vein of the whole body'. The basilica is that vein which is situated on the inner side of the arm, and is called 'cubital' by the vulgar. The funis of the arm lies upon the forearm, and this is where phlebotomy takes place when it manifests itself above the elbow. And the salvatella is the vein that lies between the little finger and the one next to it."
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	"And in the leg and thigh there are three veins: one of these lies below the curvature of the knee on the outer side. The second is the saphenous vein, whose location is behind the thigh on the inner side. The sciatic vein lies behind the thigh on the outer side. And there are other veins similar to these in the thigh."
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	"The use of the veins near the ears is for ancient catarrhs, migraine, sciatica and ulcers in the head from old injuries."
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	"And the manner of opening those veins is as follows: first, shave the head of the patient and rub it well with a soft cloth on both sides where the veins are located. Then place a firm bandage around the neck of the patient so that two places appear near the ears in two depressed areas of the head. Find the vein with your index finger and feel its pulse with your finger, then make the incision there."
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	"Then take the lancet scalpel, which is inserted, and introduce it below the vein in the elbow so that phlebotomy reaches the bone."
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	"Then raise your hand with the vein and elbow above, and make an incision in the vein with an incising cut."
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	"And let the length of the incision be about two fingers or thereabouts, and let blood flow out as much as you wish."
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Then press with cotton and plaster to stop it from bleeding until it is healed."
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	"And it has already been mentioned at the beginning of this book how to perform incisions on these veins and how to cauterize them."
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	"But of the two arterial veins that are in the temples, phlebotomy is useful for ancient migraine, chronic headache, habitual ophthalmia, and acute effusions of blood from the eyes."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	"And the manner of phlebotomy on those veins is as follows: tie a cloth tightly around the patient's neck until both veins appear prominently and their pulsation can be felt with your finger. Then make the incision there."
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	"And then raise the elbow above the vein with your index finger, introduce the phlebotomy scalpel beneath it in an incising manner and elevate the vein upwards. Then make the incision as you would on other veins, allowing blood to flow according to your needs."
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	"And then untie the bandage from the patient and place your finger on the vein for an hour. Then apply cotton and powder to it and press firmly with a tight bandage until it is healed."
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	"And their memorization and incision, as well as those of the other veins mentioned earlier in this book, have already been described."
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	"And the use of phlebotomy on the frontal vein is especially useful for ancient diseases of the face, migraine, redness, and foul ulcers."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the manner of phlebotomy on that vein is as follows: have the patient tie a bandage around their neck so that the vein appears. Then take the instrument called the 'fossor', which has this shape:"
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Place the point of the 'fossor' on that vein and pierce it with a quick strike or other cause in the manner shown, allowing blood to flow according to your desire. Then untie the perforation from the patient and press it firmly until it is healed."
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	"Sometimes it is opened with a lat flebotomy, but it need not be of acute point like other flebotomies; rather, it should be on the blunt end, for if sharp, it might break against the bone when subtle."
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	"The junction of both veins which are near the tear ducts of two eyes for scabies of the eyelids due to heat and grease in the eyes, and for facial diseases."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	"The quality of the flebotomy is such that the patient should hold their head steady with a bandage, and carefully perform the flebotomy thereupon, standing above the patient's head."
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	"And the flebotomy should be performed horizontally for about half an inch with a thin flebotomy needle, as there is little flesh in this area. If the flebotomy needle is too sharp, it might break."
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	"And carefully make the blood flow as much as necessary, and pause thereupon, pressing with that until the next day, and then remove the bandage."
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	"But the flebotomy of the nasal vein is beneficial for acute fever and sudden sneezing, and for facial diseases, migraine, and heat that occurs in the face, especially when it is chronic."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	"And the quality of this flebotomy is that the patient should hold their head steady and place their nose on their left hand, taking a thin flebotomy needle and inserting it into the middle of the forehead vertically, as the vein does not appear palpable here, and blood will begin to flow soon."
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	"Then slowly withdraw your hand along with the flebotomy needle and make the blood flow according to your needs; then bind it for one night, as it heals quickly."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	"But the benefit of flebotomy on both cheeks is to relieve pain and congestion, and to prevent or treat leprosy, eczema, itching, and corrosive ulcers like herpes."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	"And the quality of this flebotomy is that each patient should hold their head steady with their hands; and the operator should stand above the patient's head, while the patient sits on a stool."
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	"And then carefully flebotomize the vein on the long side with a large flebotomy needle little by little; then draw blood according to moderation or as much as necessary, and do the same for the other vein."
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	"And then untie the bandage and press both veins with a moderate compression to prevent the patient from fainting. Let him rest for the night, as the wound will be healed by morning."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	"And the benefit of flebotomy on the veins at the elbows is to treat small abscesses and pimples in the mouth, gingivitis, ulcers, fissures, and ulcers around the nose and its surroundings."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	"And the quality of this flebotomy is that you should make the patient sit in front of you and hold their head steady with a cloth. Then gently turn their lips and observe the two veins, one on the right lip and the other on the left; their demonstration is through their darkness, and especially where there are small dark veins around them. Then incise each one with an oblique incision."
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	"But if there is doubt and you do not know which one it is, then make the incision on the larger one of those two, or where there is evident pus."
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	"And do the same for both veins that are above the lips."
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	"But it is customary to incise both veins that are on the lower lip more often."
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	"But the benefit of flebotomy on both veins under the tongue is to treat fainting spells that occur in the throat, uvitis, and oral diseases."
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	"And the quality of flebotomizing those veins is that you should stand behind the patient facing the sunlight, raise their tongue, and observe it from below. On one side there is a vein and on the other side another vein, both tending towards darkness in color."
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	"And then flebotomize each one; but be careful not to go too deep with your hand while flebotomizing those veins, as beneath them are arteries."
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And the veins that are commonly flebotomized in the elbow are those that are present in all men. Flebotomy of these is performed in two ways: either with a flebotomy needle dipped in myrtle or olive oil, subtly inclined; or cutting with a flebotomic scalpel called 'alnessil,' and this is its form:"
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	"And this 'alnessil' is appropriate for sectioning, having sharp and subtle sides according to the width of the veins and their tension."
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	"Form of myrtle flebotomy:"
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	"The side of it should be like this: it is convenient for opening concave veins filled with blood, especially those appearing thick and containing turbid blood."
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	"And this is the form of olive flebotomy:"
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	"And this flebotomy needle is of lesser width and has a very subtle tip. It is convenient for flebotomizing small veins containing clear blood."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	"But the benefit of flebotomizing the basilica vein, which is one of three veins, is that it draws blood from diseases that are below the throat and neck, as well as from sciatica and abdominal pain."
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	"And it is convenient for the flebotomist, when flebotomizing that vein, to carefully observe and be cautious in it, as there is an artery below it. If they err and strike with the flebotomy needle, they will cut that artery and cause bleeding. Therefore, it is not advisable to flebotomize it with a pointed flebotomy needle, but rather cut with alnessil."
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the basilica vein does not appear through manifest appearance, then you should leave it and move to another one, or seek some of its branches; or flebotomize in place of it at the end of the arm where it is manifest. And cut it with alnessil flebotomy as we have said."
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	"But if you want to flebotomize the median vein, then it is necessary in front of the tension of the arm that you touch the place within which you know the location of the pulse. Then sign over it with your thumb; and bend the arm and cut the vein with a concave section using alnessil flebotomy as we have said. And be careful not to strike the artery some distance away from its location."
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	"And when you wish, as you tighten the ligature, press in the place where you have marked with your thumb. Then that swelling is swelling of the artery, and therefore avoid it."
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	"And if blood flows like a child's urine during flebotomy and the blood is red, then know that it is arterial blood. Then lift your finger from there for some distance; remove your finger, and if the bleeding stops, as often happens, then tighten the arm and leave him."
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	"And protect the patient from mucus of that wound. And be cautious with it for several days until it is healed to prevent infection."
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	"But if the bleeding does not stop and you feel that it is necessary to use a medicine for this purpose, then you have cut the artery. If it appears to you, as the end of it is contracted and the blood stops. Then take a fistful of cotton and place it there; then take some mustard seed and plaster it on; and wrap it with bandages and powder for another day."
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	"And if blood is cut off, it is good; and otherwise, then treat that with which the preceding was remembered to absorb the flow of blood."
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	"And cutting off the blood from it is difficult in many positions due to the small space of the wound and the possibility of hitting the arm's ligament."
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	"However, phlebotomy of the black vein is beneficial for drawing blood from the upper part of the head and from below the chest; for this reason it consists of branches of the basilic vein and branches of the cephalic vein, as we have said."
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	"And therefore one should be especially afraid during the phlebotomy of that [vein], because underneath it is a nerve; and therefore if one adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy and touches the nerve, stupor will occur, and its healing is difficult, and often it is not healed entirely. And this nerve can be seen by sensation many times, but if it is hidden from some people and is subtle and does not appear, then you should pause the phlebotomy with which you are performing the phlebotomy, and avoid the nerve with your strength."
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	"And if the vein is between two nerves, then you should cut the vein lengthwise."
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	"The benefit of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and relieves illnesses of the eyes."
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	"And therefore in this case, if you want the phlebotomist to puncture with an olive-shaped or myrtle-shaped phlebotomy instrument, because it is the safest of all veins, for it has neither artery nor nerve underneath."
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	"But nevertheless you should take care that with the phlebotomy instrument you do not puncture the head of the lizard alone, and search for the place where it is lightest, and do not touch it unless it is encountered first with percussion before that phlebotomy."
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	"But nevertheless, sometimes an aposteme occurs in some people when it is not phlebotomized in the first percussion, but do not touch that aposteme."
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	"But nevertheless, the quality of this phlebotomy and its accidents are many, in which you should consider their correction."
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	"The first of these is that you should know that phlebotomy is administered only for the conservation of health and in hope of its benefit and caution against the occurrence of illnesses, and that it should be performed on one of the veins which are in the elbow, namely the cephalic, basilic, or median cubital vein; and that it should be performed at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter close to meals, when signs of repletion appear."
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	"And phlebotomy should be performed on the third day or at least one day after three hours have passed since the previous bloodletting."
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	"But phlebotomy which is administered when it provokes convenience and necessity at that time, whether now or later, on any day or hour or time."
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	"And children should not be phlebotomized until they are at least fourteen years old, and women who are pregnant should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth to the seventh month, and elderly people who have already passed seventy years should not be phlebotomized."
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	"And when someone wants to be phlebotomized for any reason, they should cleanse their bowels beforehand with a lion's claw purgative, especially if there is much retained fæces in them, so that the veins do not draw the superfluities into the phlebotomy of the bowels which are purified, and do not harm the principal members."
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	"And patients with sacred nausea and gluttony should not be phlebotomized until they have removed themselves from their illness or drunkenness, nor those suffering from dropsy, and moreover phlebotomy should be feared near colic pain and vomiting, near abdominal tumors, and near multiplication of coitus and work and exercise during fasting or vigils or for any cause that dissolves virtue, whether corporeal or animal."
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	"And also consider the subtlety of the humors before that, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible to do so."
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	"And also take a bath if there is no prohibition for doing so, or stimulate with some exercise so that the blood may be subtilized."
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And pause the phlebotomy of it in the evening, around the hour of Terce, as we have said."
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	"And perform that evening as guarded in that day from all animal bad accidents, such as anxiety, anger, fear, and from all corporeal accidents, such as work and superfluous effort and coitus and their like."
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	"And at his seat, let the causes be present in the use of which men are accustomed with aromatics and fragrances and with balms and their like according to the quantity of possibility."
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	"And follow the phlebotomist on a cushion that is higher than the cushion of the one who is to be phlebotomized."
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	"And also extend his arm, and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and also stretch the limb with a bandage and wrap it twice."
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	"And let the bandage be moderate, for a bandage that is not equal can prohibit the flow of blood, or one with superfluity, and likewise one with softening can prohibit the course of the blood equally."
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	"And also during the bandage, let him who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together within them until the veins are inflated and declared to the touch."
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	"And also the phlebotomist should anoint his scalpel with a little ancient olive oil properly; and also let him place his index finger of his left hand over that vein, away from the location where the phlebotomy is desired, so that the vein may yield somewhat, and the percussion be situated where one of the veins which underlie the phlebotomy is struck, like strings fleeing beneath it, and those are full of windiness, and when the scalpel pauses upon them they contract beneath the scalpel, and the phlebotomist descends; and the scalpel does not open the vein, and if it opens, that vein is narrow."
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	"And therefore, let the phlebotomist be firm and attentive to all these causes."
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	"And also let him pause the scalpel, but if the vein is opened in one attempt, that is good; and if not, then repeat that elsewhere away from that location somewhat, or above it with haste, if the location is not inflamed."
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	"And if the location is inflamed or the illness worsens, then let him leave it for a day or two, and do not stretch the limb, for otherwise it would draw an ulcerous inflammation, nor take a bath."
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	"And also repeat the phlebotomy if necessary."
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	"And if the opening is small and blood flows subtly, and you fear that it will not let out the desired quantity of blood, then repeat the scalpel in that track according to rectitude and adjust the opening somewhat, and do this with haste before the location becomes inflamed, for many people have inflammation occur due to a few openings."
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	"But if the location is already inflamed, then do not repeat upon it, for it serves no purpose; and pause upon it some part of the fold of olive oil, for that alleviates the course of blood."
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	"And it is better in this location to use olive oil than any other oils."
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	"Similarly administer oil during any phlebotomy to prevent veins from prohibiting the flow of blood. They do this with theriac and sagazena when placed upon one of those locations, because blood becomes subtler and revolves when it's thick."
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	"If a large boil forms at the site of phlebotomy, as often happens, especially if not much blood has been drawn previously, or when the vein is barely opened, then you should, immediately after, place on that location a damp sponge infused with water and salt, slightly warmed, and hold it there for an hour, as this will dissolve it."
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	"You should also do that near the site of bloodletting from that vein with some vinegar or from another vein."
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	"But if some blackness or greenness remains at the site for several days, do not worry about it. And if you wish, place over that area some plaster of aloe and myrrh dissolved in vinegar, or some plaster of mint juice or chamomile juice or something similar."
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	"And many times it happens that boils and swellings occur which need phlebotomy at the basilica."
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	"And then place your hand over it, and if you suddenly feel softness, apply pressure with your hand on that swelling, for at that moment the artery is flowing strongly. And then protect yourself by placing some of what we have said upon it, because a lot of blood flows from the artery."
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And make an emplaster with what is styptic, so that the location remains firm. And treat it with other treatments until it heals."
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	"And you should draw blood from each person according to the quantity of their strength and according to the prevailing color that appears above the blood."
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	"For if the blood is black, let it flow until it becomes red. And similarly, if you find it thick, let it flow until it thins out. And likewise, if it is sharp, let it flow until its sharpness subsides."
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	"And for one who is full and strong and needs bloodletting at once, the phlebotomy of a vein should be increased and the phlebotomy wound made wide."
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	"And in one who is frail, do the opposite of that, and let blood from him little by little over several days, and let the wound be narrow."
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	"It is better to make a transverse section in phlebotomy of a vein than to make a puncture."
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	"And this manner of phlebotomy saves from the flow of blood and from injury to nerves. And it is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy made according to width and length."
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	"And for one who is accustomed to fainting during phlebotomy, you should treat him beforehand with a little bread infused in rue wine or simple celery seed wine and scraped. And let blood from him three or four times."
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	"And if it is coldness of temperament, then take beforehand in phlebotomy bread infused in myrrh syrup or in aromatic honey syrup with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and the like, or in syrup that is aromatic and very fragrant."
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	"And if fainting occurs during phlebotomy and it is due to the loss of much blood, then you should give him to drink water of meat and very fragrant syrup. And use aromatics with almonds, and let him lie down on his left side."
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	"And use the other causes that we have mentioned in the division in the chapter of fainting due to evacuation."
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	"And whoever wants to stimulate his arm and dissolve his blood on the second day should let blood from one who has had much evacuation by phlebotomy, and whose virtue is frail. Let it flow little by little, according to the quantity of his strength over several continuous days."
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	"However, whoever wants to stimulate his arm and draw his blood again on the second day, and if his body is strong, then do this about seven or nine hours after the first phlebotomy."
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	"However, whoever wants to draw blood from his body contrary to the part that declines, let it be done on the second or third day."
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	"However, in a body where there is little blood already scraped and it is sharp and causes fever, let blood be drawn from him once and let much blood flow. And make the opening wide so that fainting may occur, for you have preserved all the conditions of phlebotomy. And place your hand over the pulse of his artery before letting blood, so that he does not die instead of fainting, because many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent."
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	"And when you want to stimulate the arm and evacuate blood again on the second day, it is not necessary to do so if the opening of the vein has already been closed and it is difficult to draw blood. Then press upon that with force and curve it gently, for that is too bad."
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	"Let him lie down until he can be phlebotomized again. Or remove that with the acuteness of the flebotomy which is coagulated from the blood in the opening of the vein. Or place upon it tyriaca alfarach or sage, and press upon it gently until the blood flows out."
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	"And if the vein is inflamed, then leave that alone and do not touch it until the inflammation has subsided."
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	"And if there is a need to provoke you to evacuate blood again and there is no excuse for it, then do so on that same spot or on the other arm in another vein."
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	"And the vein called 'the rope of the arm' is phlebotomized in place of the cephalic or the basilica when they are not found or are obscured, for it is composed of those."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	"And the quality of phlebotomizing him is that the patient should put his hand in warm water until the vein appears prominently."
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	"And phlebotomize strongly upon that with a bandage with moderate tightness. And phlebotomize according to the transverse line, not latitudinally nor according to length."
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	"And let the opening be wide and let your phlebotomy be such that you phlebotomize him on the junction of his hand."
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	"And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse your hand in warm water again and let the blood run into the water until you achieve your purpose."
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	"However, if it is summer, then you are excused from immersing your hand in warm water. And in winter, the body of the blood should be kept warm in warm water."
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	"And phlebotomizing this vein is safer than all other veins because there are neither pulsating veins nor nerves in its vicinity."
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	"And phlebotomizing the wrist of the right hand corresponds to diseases of the liver."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	"And the quality of phlebotomizing him is that you should strengthen his hand with a bandage or with your hand, because you have placed it in warm water until the vein becomes inflated and is clearly visible. And phlebotomize him transversely; and if he does not faint completely, do not worry about it."
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	"And be careful not to extend your hand during phlebotomy because there are nerves nearby that are devoid of flesh."
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	"And be sure to immerse your hand in warm water and let the blood run into it because if you do not immerse it in warm water, the blood will clot at the opening of the vein and prevent its flow."
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	"And when the blood is extracted according to necessity, then place over the vein oil and salt, so that it may not be consolidated carelessly."
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	"Among the benefits of phlebotomy is that it relieves illnesses of the liver."
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	"And do likewise in the phlebotomy of the other arm, just as you have done with the other one."
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	"And the benefit of the saphenous vein phlebotomy is for illnesses that are in the lower parts of the body, such as diseases of the womb and retention of menses, and for the healing of wounds, old ulcers on thighs and legs, and their like."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	"And the procedure for phlebotomy is that the patient puts his foot in cold water and makes friction around where the veins appear; then tie a bandage above the joint of the foot; and the place of the vein should be apparent below the said hole, from which many branches go forth on the face of the foot."
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	"And then perform phlebotomy on the most prominent vein or one below the ankle below the joint, for it is better and more beneficial."
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	"And if you perform phlebotomy on the face of the foot, then beware of the nerves that are below that on the surface of the foot, and pause your phlebotomy with that which you cut across, as if you wanted to incise it."
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	"And thus ends the phlebotomy."
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	"It is forbidden to let blood from him; therefore, you warm his foot in hot water and let the blood flow into that vessel until it is evacuated."
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if the bloodletter errs in his first attempt, he should repeat it elsewhere, for the place is swollen. Do not fear causing harm, but rather protect yourself from nerves as we have said."
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	"And similarly, do the same with the other foot."
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	"Regarding the sciatic vein, the place is at the back of the ankle joint below the bone of departure."
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	"And the benefit of bloodletting from him is for a pain in the hip when it is for burning blood."
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	"And the quality of bloodletting from him is that he enters into a bath, and quickly and vigorously tie his chest on the right side of the hipbone above the ankle with a long thin bandage so that it does not appear except by that."
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	"And then when it appears, you should bloodlet from that according to each vein that is accessible and according to the cross section, which is better. Or else cut that with an incision or cut it with a section because the place is swollen."
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	"And it is especially common in young men. And if you cannot find that vein, then bloodlet from any branch of it, and it is that which appears on the back of the hand near the said little finger and ring finger."
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	"And guard yourself from nerves, and let the blood flow out in the amount you desire."
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	"Then loosen the ligature and pause on the place of the bloodletting until it stops. Then squeeze the place gently because it is easily healed."
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	"Of wind breaking and of its qualities for using those."
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	"A ventosa can be made from horns, or earthenware, or glass."
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	"And bloodletting is done in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is without scarification."
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	"And this bloodletting which is scarification occurs in two ways, either with fire or without fire."
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	"And the locations where bloodletting is performed through scarification and extraction of blood are fourteen parts of the body. Of these, one is on the nape of the neck, which is the last part of the head; the middle location between two parts of the collarbone; the chin below the mandible near the mouth; the spatulas' locations; the alocostrum, which is above the end of the ribcage; the forearms, two on each arm; and the cavities, as well as the buttocks."
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	"And bloodletting does not extract blood from the large veins but rather from the small ones scattered throughout the flesh, and therefore it does not draw out the vital spirits in that way, just as phlebotomy is said to do; nor should bloodletting be performed with fire or without fire in any illness caused bypletion until the whole body has been evacuated."
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	"But if bloodletting is necessary due to illness or continually, we administer it at the beginning of the month and at the end, and in the middle of it, and at any time that may be appropriate."
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	"The reason for this is that some men have an abundance of blood within them, which necessitates its extraction through bloodletting and produces symptoms such as heaviness and dizziness in the head; others exhibit signs ofpletion such as heat and redness in their face, head, and neck; while others show signs of melancholy such as dullness and darkness in their eyes. Some have an increased desire to yawn; others laugh excessively; some have a taste of blood in their mouth or a bleeding tongue that spits out blood; still others sleep too much or experience nightmares with heat, anxiety, and other causes that affect them."
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	"And therefore, when there is a need for bloodletting due to one of those causes, especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, we command that bloodletting be done three hours after two hours have passed."
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	"And the benefit of bloodletting from the neck is that it relieves heaviness in the head and prevents dizziness and fainting spells; but this should be done as part of a general evacuation of the whole body."
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	"And this bloodletting is performed at the location called phlebotomy of the cephalic vein."
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	"It is not suitable for those who are of cold complexion or have catarrh to use it, as it causes great harm."
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	"And therefore, it should not be used for the elderly, nor for those with hot illnesses in their head."
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	"But those who continuously use bloodletting become forgetful of it; therefore, you should command the bloodletter to pause his hand slightly after placing the bloodletting cup on the skin at its departure points, so as to prevent the generation of forgetfulness."
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	"But bloodletting at the elbow is done at the location of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilica vein: therefore it treats asthma, constriction of the throat, and tearing of the instrument of respiration, as well as coughing andpletion."
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	"And it is necessary to remove the bloodletting cup from the elbow a little earlier than usual, because if left too long it causes weakness in the body and stomach."
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	"And bloodletting at the angle of the jaw treats accidental pains in the head, ophthalmia, migraine, and inflammation of the face, as well as pains in the roots of the teeth. It is performed at the location of phlebotomy of the basilica vein."
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	"And you should command the bloodletter not to press his hand during scarification, so as not to cut the artery and cause an excessive flow of blood."
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	"And bloodletting from the chin treats thrush in the mouth, gum disease, and symptoms of diseases that are present there. It is performed at the location of phlebotomy of the linguual veins found on both lips."
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	"But bloodletting done over the two spatulas treats headache, which is caused bypletion of heat."
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	"And bloodletting at the two divisions of the temples treats the benefits of phlebotomy of three veins, namely the basilica, dark, and cephalic veins. This is because it attracts blood from all those smaller veins found in the flesh, as well as the smaller veins connected to those larger veins, so that the attraction reaches the three veins."
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	"And command the bloodletter not to proceed with scarification, because the location is bare of flesh and there are nerves and arteries near it."
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	"And this bloodletting is performed on the ankles, treating hemorrhoids of the anus and ulcers nearby."
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	"And it is necessary to command the bloodletter that a large cup should be used and made of brass because the location requires a strong section; furthermore, subtle bloodletting cups are poorly drawn here, and scarification with scarification is necessary."
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	"But bloodletting from the thighs diminishes by diminution manifests that it attracts blood from all over the body and treats ancient pains of the loins and belly, as well as the bladder. It also provokes menstruation and treats boils and ulcers. It is performed at the location of phlebotomy of two saphenous veins, the angle of the knee, and two cavities."
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	"However, it also debilitates the whole body and causes fainting spells in many men."
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	"And the benefit of bloodletting at the angle of the knee is similar to the benefit of bloodletting on both thighs."
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	"And the quality of the position of bloodletting is that you should pause at the beginning, remove it slightly and follow up with gentle suction, and not prolong the position of bloodletting but rather pause it lightly and remove it gently so that the humours come to the location by gradual attraction."
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	"And do not cease repeating this until you see the location already reddened and swollen, and that the color of blood appears."
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	"Then scars are made and suction is repeated little by little. And consider well the condition of the patients' bodies."
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	"Because that person who has tender flesh and rare pores should be scarified once but not more than that, so that the location does not become ulcerated."
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	"And command the bloodletter to amplify scarification slightly and prolong it a little, and apply suction with ease."
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	"And if there is thickness in the blood, then it is necessary to scarify twice because in the first scarification, the way for suction of the blood and its fluidity is opened."
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	"But in the second one, the extraction of thick blood is acquired by observation."
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	"And if the blood is very fetid, then there should be no scarification in the third veigning so that it may be dried."
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	"Finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or a little at a time, one scarification suffices for us."
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	"And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we scarify with many scars; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify with prolonged scarification."
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	"And the term of scarification is only as deep as the skin."
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	"And if the skin is thick, hard, dark, and its pores are narrow, then the locations of bloodletting should be anointed with lenient, open, resolvent oils; if it is in summer time, such as oil of aloe or violet oil, or oil of bitter almonds, or oil of chamomile flower; and if it is in wintertime, then oil of narcissus, or lily oil, or camomile oil, or blood oil, and those similar."
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	"If excess fluid is thick and cold, then the oil should be myrrh, or balsamite, or aloe, or aneth, and their like."
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	"If the patient has tender skin with wide pores, then oil should be prohibited, and instead, the places where vents occur nearby should be washed with hot or cold water of salt, or with decoction of wormwood, or with decoction of borrage, and similar remedies."
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	"And for one whose blood has great humidity, wash their vents with sour wine, or water of myrtle and sumac, and similar remedies."
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	"And for one whose excess fluids are thick, wash their vents with old wine, or water of hyssop, which is majoram, or decoction of dill, or chamomile, and their like."
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	"And it is necessary that the ventosing be done before bathing; having to be administered near to the time of bathing for one hour or two, and having to sleep near to the ventosing."
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	"What is it that is necessary so that a patient who has undergone bloodletting should regulate his vents before ventosing."
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	"At the beginning, consider if the patient or the one who should undergo bloodletting is choleric and vents over his hot and inflamed blood, then they should take cooling remedies, such as acetic grapes, endive with sour wine and lettuce, and secanabin, julep, and similar ones."
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	"And pause their meals such as poles ( turnips), and flesh of roasted birds, and foods seasoned with sourness, and similar ones."
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	"And for one whose constitution is phlegmatic, let him take to drink syrups such as aloe syrup, or althaea syrup of seeds, and sumac, and sweet-smelling wine between autumn and winter; and that he be advised to use little drinking and eating, and pause from foods such as turnips, cannabis, peas, and small birds and doves."
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	"And on the day of ventosing and bloodletting, drinking should be greater than eating."
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	"And it should be given to drink to some men tyriaca alhacema, or musc medicines, such as musk or aloe syrup, before ventosing or bloodletting or near the time of it, so that their principal members are comforted and their blood is subtilized; and they should not take that scalphat."
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.
