Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	"But when the bone is stripped of its periosteum and cut, you should apply a plaster made of flour from a millstone mixed with egg albumen. Then place it on top of the lesion and also place a wad of cloth or cotton behind the patient's shoulder to support it if necessary. Then take a long bandage, about as wide as a palm or somewhat wider, and fold it in two lengthwise. Then apply powder doubly over the plaster. Then take a thin tablecloth strip that is about three digits wide and similarly long, wrap it around the bandage, and then wrap the whole thing with cloth at the location of the fracture. Then take another wad of cotton, roll it up, and place it on top of the lesion and behind the patient's shoulder and chest to support it while reducing the fracture in all parts until the fracture becomes firm."
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	"And all of this is done while avoiding putting pressure on the fractured bone. And you should see the patient every day to ensure that the bandage does not become loose or slip off as the swelling decreases. If it does, then correct it and tighten the bandage."
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	"And also make the patient sleep on their back with a small pillow placed at their side at night. This will elevate the adjutors of their shoulder and thus elevate the fracture of the clavicle and reduce strain on the muscles, or keep the arm bound to their chest."
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	"And do not remove the bandage until about twelve days have passed unless there is persistent redness or an abscess in that location."
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	"And also renew the plaster if you see that its face is dry by then, and adjust it to fit the swelling, restore it, and leave it in place until the fracture of the clavicle has healed and united."
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	"And healing is usually achieved within twenty-eight days, although sometimes it may take less time in certain individuals."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter VI"
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	"On the restoration of fractures of the shoulder."
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	"A fracture of the scapula usually occurs on its lateral border and does not affect the body of the bone but only the margins."
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	"When the fracture is located on the medial border of the scapula and not visible except by touch, then prepare the reduction according to its shape and reduce it naturally in every way that you are able."
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	"And then apply plaster made of fine powdered millstone with egg albumen and linen cloth. Then apply powder made of folded cloth. Then apply a thin bandage around the entire scapula or somewhat wider."
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	"But if the bandage is concave at some point on the scapula, then fill in that concavity with linen cloth and smooth out the bandage evenly."
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	"And also secure it above with a long wad of cotton that is gently compressed and ensure that the bandage does not slip from its proper location."
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	"Check the bandage every day. If it becomes loose at any time, replace it and tighten it again to ensure that the bandage does not slip from its proper location."
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	"And make the patient lie on their side."
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	"The scapula is usually restored in twenty days or less."
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	"And when this number of days is completed, then remove the bandage, and be sure that you know how to distinguish which bones have solid union without removal."
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	"And if you are treating a fracture of the humerus and placing it at the side of the elbow, then split it open there and follow what was said regarding the reduction of a hematoma in the clavicle fracture if one occurs here."
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter VII"
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	"Regarding the healing of a broken foot."
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	"The foot sometimes breaks in the middle and this can be difficult to heal; but its ends usually grow back together, although they are shortened and fragmented."
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	"And when the middle of the foot breaks, it declines towards its parts inside and accidents can happen to it with great pain, difficulty in healing, coughing, fever, vomiting blood; and there is an obvious deformity in the cavity of the broken bone which cannot be hidden from touch."
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	"And for its healing, the patient should be placed on their back, and a pillow should be placed between the soles of their feet; gently press on the muscles of the foot, adjust the bones with two hands, carefully operate and equalize according to any possible manner that is appropriate and convenient, until the figure of the bone returns to its proper position."
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	"And gently apply plaster and gauze, then place on a thin table board of sauce or chalk and its likes in levitation, since you wrap that up with cloth; carefully apply it onto the broken bone so as not to move it; sometimes tie it around the back according to the roundness, and tighten it with appropriate strapping; regularly check the bandage, and when softened, tighten it again."
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	"And if there is a need for removal of the bandage due to corruption or inflammation, pain, or an abscess occurring in that place, you should remove and untie it immediately, remove the plaster, correct what has happened with the manner of curing it; and apply plaster again if necessary, sometimes changing its face; adjust the strapping until it is healed."
Capitol .viii.	Capítulo VIII
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Chapter VIII
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	Know that fractures of the ribs occur only in large spaces that are on the back, and at the ends of those bones near their joints it happens only rarely because they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And knowledge of him is not concealed from His perception despite His inquiry with them.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration should be such that you align the fracture according to your knowledge with the possible manner, so that it can heal according to need. Afterwards apply plaster and strengthen the broken bone with steel if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	And if the rib fracture extends to its inner partitions, then severe pain and piercing are experienced by the patient, similar to that which is felt by someone who has cried. This happens because the bone pierces the pleura. Difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting blood also occurs, making it difficult to treat.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And even the Ancients were skilled in treating that with many techniques.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And they said this: it is necessary to withhold food from the patient who has caused inflammation and flatulence, so that the abdomen becomes inflated and extended, pushing the fracture towards its outer partitions.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	But we should not do this because it could easily cause an internal abscess if not done carefully. And if one has already occurred, then it can help with that too.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And some of them said that one should suspend wind and then suck it with force; this is similar to reasoning. However, it is feared that the wind might drive the excess fluids to the site due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And some of them said: the location should be covered with wool that has been immersed in warm oil, and fine powders should be inserted between the ribs until it is filled. Then, wrap it according to its roundness like a bandage. And treat the patient with pleurisy remedies and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	"If the patient's severe constriction cannot be endured and the bone pierces the membrane with a sharp point, then fear for the patient; therefore we should cut upon that place, break open the shattered rib, and immediately place over that instrument which preserves the circle of remembrance, previously mentioned, and insert the bone gently, extracting that."
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	"If we need to adjust both lips of the wound, if it is large, with sutures, and heal it with plasters until it is healed."
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	"If an abscess occurs inside the wound, then cover it and press powder made from rose oil onto the location, until the wound is healed as necessary for an internal abscess."
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	"And let him be propped up on pillows while he lies upon the bed until he is healed."
Capitol .ix.	Chapter ix.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	"Concerning the restoration of fractures of the spine of the back and neck."
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some fractures occur in the bones of the neck, and they sometimes become inflamed, likewise those of the spine.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And if it happens to someone and you want to know whether they will be cured or not, then consider this: if sometimes their muscles are already softened and stunned and dead, so that those cannot move nor extend nor shrink those anymore, and when you press those with your fingers or prick those with a needle and do not feel pain in those, then you shall know that it is not healed, and such conditions are mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if those can move and feel constraint with your fingers and prick there, then you shall know that the neck of the bone is saved and that the illness will recover with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if it seems similar in the vertebrae of the neck and you want to know whether they will be healed or not, then consider their weight.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you find that they are already softened like those above, then it has happened to these what has happened to the muscles, and especially when lying on his back, he feels vertigo and evacuation without his will, and sometimes he is suddenly overturned on his back and wants to urinate but cannot. Then you shall know that it is mortal, and at that point do not bother with its treatment.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if none of those things happen to him, the cause is better and easier to treat.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment of it is that you pierce into the sedative place of the hard abscess which lies over the injured spine on the right side, or with the mouth of a pouch apply heat there: lie over that several times a day until it is softened the hard abscess.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then apply one of the comforting and dispersing plasters there, and strengthen it with a bandage. And command to the patient that he use rest and tranquility and do not sleep on the part where he feels pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	"If an accident occurs due to a bone fracture or any other cause that has separated it, then you must cut above the elbow and remove that bone. Then immediately stitch the two edges of the wound with sutures if it is large; then treat it with some ointment from herbs until it heals."
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	"If the tip of the bone is broken and it's the end of the joint, then you must insert the index finger of your left hand into the anus and gently press on the broken bone with your other hand as much as possible according to the appropriate position; then apply a plaster or bandage if necessary, and then straighten that."
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	"If you feel something broken inside, then go over there, remove it, and treat the wound with appropriate care until it heals."
Capitol .x.	Chapter .x
De restauracio de la ancha.	Of the Restoration of Health
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	"The bones of the arms are sometimes broken and when they break, the fracture is usually located at the ends of those bones and extends along their length towards the interior. In addition to pain in that location and puncture wounds, numbness occurs if it's a fracture."
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	"And the restoration of this is done by extending your hand over that area until it covers the fracture as shown in the figure."
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	"And if the fracture is only at the end of it, then you should gently press on that area until it aligns with its natural shape according to your judgment."
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	"But if the fracture is in the middle or has already shifted towards the interior, then place the patient on their back to prepare for the restoration of that fracture."
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	"And once you've aligned it, apply a plaster and also apply traction using a splint made of wood or metal, being careful not to cause puncture wounds or displacement of the fracture."
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	"And align the concave surface and press it until it takes on traction according to equality. Then have the patient sleep on their back or side."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	"But if an abscess forms later, then stop the extension and restoration until the abscess is drained. Then apply what is needed to drain that according to what has been said earlier; and return to the restoration of it, and strengthen it as necessary."
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	"And if this happens in the leg bones or they are crushed, then remove them."
Capitol .xi.	"Chapter eleven."
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	"Regarding the treatment of a broken bone."
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	"The collarbone, which is between the chest and the head of the shoulder."
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	"And if it is broken, its treatment can be approached in one of two ways. The first way is to take a piece of wood..."
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	"and attach two bandages at both ends; it should then be suspended from an elevated place."
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	"The patient should sit on a chair, then place their broken arm over the board so that its tip reaches the middle point where the curvature of the board is attached."
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	"Then suspend something heavy from that [point] or the nurse can gently pull it towards the sides. And then the physician will align the fracture with his hands until the fracture returns to its original position."
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	"The other way is for the patient to lie on their back and suspend their arm with a bandage. Then command two nurses: one should hold what is above the fracture with both hands, and the other should hold the part below it. Each of them should gently pull at their respective ends."
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	"And if you want to increase the traction force, then place another bandage over the fracture and another one above it. Then each of the two nurses should pull at their respective ends."
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	"If the fracture is close to the end of the muscle, then place half of the bandage on the tip and the other half below the fracture near the elbow."
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	"And similarly, if the fracture is near the elbow, then place the bandage over that location and also over the elbow."
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	"Once it is properly aligned and secured without causing distress, then wait for it to be set according to what is necessary and applied well. Then gently stretch it so that there is no heat buildup."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	"But if there is heat buildup, then leave the splint on for seven days. Then remove it and apply a clean cloth soaked in warm water and rose oil over where the heat buildup occurred until it subsides. Then gently stretch it."
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	"The way to gently stretch it is to apply a plaster cast over the fracture. Then place a layer of linen cloth soaked in new wine and oil over the plaster cast. Then adjust the arm using that support and place their hand, covered with a cloth, on top of their muscle."
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	"And then tie the cloth and gently stretch it over the support for the arm so that the arm is in a straight position, unless prohibited by any reason related to the broken bone."
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	"And then apply splints."
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	"And place on the fracture that splint which is widest and strongest among the others. Place it between each finger width apart, and let its length be according to the break with an additional three fingers' width on either side."
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	"And then apply traction using the splint with the bandage mentioned at the beginning of this chapter."
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	"And ensure that your traction is applied as closely to the fracture site as possible."
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	"And as the fracture heals, gradually decrease the traction."
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	"Therefore, if you wish to remove the splints and traction as described in the time when restoring the limb to its original position, then do so."
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you fear heat buildup, leave the traction and splints on for seven days, as mentioned earlier."
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	"Also consider the limb in all cases for three days so that no swelling or inflammation occurs there due to excess pressure from the splint. If necessary, reduce or adjust the diet as prescribed by your physician."
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	"But if you feel confident that nothing will happen from this, then do not remove the bandage for three days or more."
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	"And let their sleep be on their back with their arms over their stomach."
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	"And place a full pillow of wool at the elbow and constantly monitor day and night that the figure of the broken limb does not dislocate or become softened. If it does, then adjust accordingly with your skill."
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	"And feed the patient according to the order given earlier, ensuring that their food is soft at first until they begin to heal. Then gradually increase the thickness of their food."
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	"The custom is that the splint and its cloth are strengthened for forty days. Then they should be removed, a bath administered, and the area treated with ointments that will correct it."
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	"And if the fracture is healed completely, then do not remove the splint and splints for one day or two months."
Capitol .xii.	"Chapter XII."
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	"On the restoration of broken arms."
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	"The arm is composed of two bones called 'two forks.' One is small and is located near the thumb, while the other is large and extends from the little finger's side."
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	"Either the larger fork bone alone can break or both bones together."
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	"And when the small fork bone is broken at its upper end, then its restoration and healing will be easier."
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	"But when it is broken near its lower end, the fracture is bad and its healing difficult."
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	"And worse still is when both bones are broken together."
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	"Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the small fork bone at its upper end, then it is necessary for the physician to restore it with ease by using a small extension until it is healed."
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	"But if it is the large fork bone that is broken, then a stronger extension must be used."
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	"And if both bones are broken together, then traction must be applied very strongly."
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	"And the figure of the hand must be restored and its extension laid out on a pillow with the palm upwards, placing the thumb highest among all the fingers, the little finger lowest, and the patient centered on a cushioned chair."
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	"And place a pillow in front of him at his height or slightly below it, so that he does not have to struggle."
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	"Then one assistant should extend the arm from its lower part with their hand or a bandage, while another extends it upwards in the same manner."
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	"And then the physician should heal the bone until they have reduced it to the best figure possible."
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	"If there is any displacement in the fracture of the bone, then forcefully reduce it back into its proper place with your skill."
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	"If a separated fragment appears that prevents the elbow from extending and you have no hope of restoring it, then perform the procedure described earlier to fix it."
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	"But if the fracture is accompanied by a wound, I have already dealt with that in Chapter X. Therefore, take care of it accordingly."
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	"And if heat buildup occurs at the beginning of your restoration, then lay a cloth soaked in cerote made from rose oil and white wax over it. The cloth should be neither too thick nor too thin. Then apply gentle pressure with another cloth until the heat subsides. Remove the cerote and apply an emplaster prepared from powdered mallow with clay of eggs and honey. Then apply splints; the splint that is placed over the fracture should be broad and strong."
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	"You should know that the number of splints for the arm varies depending on the situation, whether it is a fracture in one bone or both bones together."
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	"Then apply pressure over the site of the fracture very strongly and forcefully. If the extension is directed towards the upper part of the fracture or its lower part, then apply gentle pressure afterwards according to what was mentioned at the beginning of this chapter."
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"Let the cloths wrapped around the fracture be soft and moist, not hard or rough. Let the thread with which it is sewn be neither too fine nor too thick, as we have recommended."
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	"And consider the limb and its condition after several days."
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	"And if any cause arises requiring correction, such as swelling of the limb, then you should apply cold water compresses until that swelling subsides."
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	"And let the limb rest without constraint until it regains its usual position."
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	"And once the inflammation has subsided and the bone is aligned properly, then adjust everything with your skill."
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	"And also consider if the nourishment is prevented from reaching the limb due to excessive constriction; then you should gently relax it slightly and leave it for a few days until the nourishment flows freely again."
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	"But if no such cause arises as those we have mentioned, then it should not be released within about twenty days or so."
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	"And then let the patient's arm be suspended by its usual means of movement for a few days, and have him lie on his back to sleep."
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	"And know that this fracture is usually restored in thirty days or sometimes even thirty-two days, but it could also be restored in twenty-eight days, depending on the individual's constitution and the power of their nature."
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the restoration of fractures of the fingers and toes.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	"Know that in the case of fractures of the fingers or toes, they rarely happen without some injury to them."
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	"And when such fracture or injury happens to the hand, then it is necessary for the patient to lie on his back with his head elevated according to equality, and gently suspend the injured arm above him while extended."
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	"And then the attendant should extend the broken bones and the physician should bind them together so that they are well aligned with good approximation."
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	"And then it is necessary to apply a plaster and cotton, unless there is an abscess that requires cauterization. Then also apply a splint above according to the size of the location, with that already wrapped in linen."
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	"But if the fracture is in the middle of the palm near the belly of the hand, then make a similar splint of linen and command the patient to hold it with his palm clasped. Then also secure it with a long strip of linen."
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	"And let the splint be made of leather covered with linen and elevated so that the leather is applied to the palm. Then secure it according to what is necessary."
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	"But if the fracture is at the outside of the hand, then it is necessary to apply a splint above and another splint from the little finger side in the palm so that the hand is elevated and straight. Then also apply the bandage as when wrapping around the wrist."
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	"And if there is a fracture of one of the toes of the foot, then it should be aligned as necessary and then secured with the sole of the foot. And if you wish, apply a small splint on the outside to elevate the fracture and prevent movement."
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	"But if the fracture is in other toes, such as in the middle toe or the index toe, the ring toe, or the little toe, then it should be aligned and tied with the string of the corresponding toe; or all the toes may be tied together continuously, which is better; or a small splint may be applied to it, as we have said for the big toe."
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	"And consider, in the restoration of these fractures, and particularly that one, the condition of any abscess formation or opposition that may occur during your operation. Act accordingly when any such cause arises, as described above."
Capitol .xiv.	"Chapter Fourteen."
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	"Of the Reduction of Fractures of the Tibia."
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The hip bone of the thigh often breaks and is declared apparent in sensation as it turns to the front and upwards.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And its restoration is done in such a way that the ligament strengthens over the fracture and another ligament leaves the fracture, and the patient is prone on their stomach and face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And moreover, the surgeon stretches all the ligaments to their destination according to their nature when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it extends to the thigh's ridge, then the ligament attached to the tendon should be pulled towards the front of the knee, so that the tension takes place there, and the other ligament leaves the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And likewise if the fracture is close to the knee, then it should be done with the ligament attached to the tendon, and its tension should be applied from below.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And moreover the doctor brings the bone together with both of its ends until it reduces according to its natural form and the bone is joined by good union; then it is necessary to apply plaster and compression, otherwise gangrene may occur in the member.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if gangrene occurs, then you should leave it for some days until the gangrene has dried up and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The compression should be done thus: first, wrap a hard bandage over the fracture and fold it two or three times, removing any excess; then wrap the limb so that it reaches the ankle and thigh ridge.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And insert a long splint between the thigh and the bandage near the knee below, bringing the ends of the splint from above on both sides, then wrap it around the bandage and thigh with what remains of the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then place a pad over the thigh at that fracture point, and place one stake on the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	Then fill the spaces between the leg and thigh with soft rags to keep the compression in place.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	Then begin with strong compression from the middle over the fracture point with three or four layers, and as you move away from the fracture site, gradually reduce the compression, making it less strong and more flexible.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	Then extend both ends of the splint below to reach the ankle bone, and tighten both ends of the other stake on that side to ensure that the ligament does not slip from its position.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	Then leave the compression in place with this caution: ensure that there is no injury to the limb, nor gangrene or blisters, nor inflammation or swelling similar to these; and if any of these occur, then carefully remove it and correct whatever has happened immediately, as we have said many times before.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone sticks out where it was broken, then you should smooth it off as much as possible; and if not, file it down and remove it, and treat with whatever is necessary for healing until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And sometimes this fracture of the thighbone may become tighter than the stakes used for it, as we have said in the case of the elbow and arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	But nevertheless in the restoration of the limb in this way there should not occur a limp or limping gait. And if it is restored alone without applying the other thighbone, then that leg will always limp.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	"Know that the illness can last for 40 days or slightly more or less, and all this depends on the diversity of complexions and other dispositions."
Capitol .xv.	"Chapter XV."
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	"On the reduction of a tooth fracture."
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	"You should know that fractures of the tooth crown rarely occur, but they can happen due to strong blows or trauma."
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	"However, if a fracture does occur, it is usually just a crack or break in its parts, which amounts to very little or somewhat more, and all this is done with caution."
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	"And the restoration of it is easy, so that what is broken of its parts may be joined together with the said glue and congealed according to what is possible for equality, facility, and manufacture."
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	"And also apply a plaster and bandage over that round tooth if necessary, and strengthen it with a suitable strapping."
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	"And also consider all the dispositions which we have recommended for other fractures, such as pus cautery and similar things, so that everything may be applied according to whatever is convenient for it, so that it may heal."
Capitol .xvi.	"Chapter XVI."
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	"On the restoration of a broken arch (crown)."
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	"Know this: in the hip joint are two bones, one large and named for its resemblance to a chamber, the other subtle and called the trochanter."
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	"And concerning the various types of fractures that can occur to the two bones of the arm, restoration is made just as it is with dislocation of the arm, and its operation is one."
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	"And if two bones are crushed at once, the joint becomes completely separated."
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	"And if only the thinner bone is broken, the joint remains somewhat displaced."
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	"And if the larger bone is broken alone, it causes immediate paralysis, which is one of the causes that are not amendable."
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	"And appropriate extension and equination and ligamentation of the fragments should be applied according to that dislocation."
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	"But nevertheless, if a fracture of the joint is displaced having many fragments, care should be taken to make the extension gentle and lighter, and aided by your virtue."
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	"And in case of operation on the joint of the arm, this is when you dislocate the fragments and complete all your operation, then you will take pieces of wood from pine that are prepared beforehand for those causes which are placed below, and they should be made equally of branches of palm; choose those that are slender, not thick ones, and their length according to the length of the joint, and place them from the front to behind."
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	"And appropriately wrap around each splint in two layers according to its length, and place one on the fracture of the joint on one side and the other on the other side, and they should be placed from front to back on the thigh of the leg."
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	"And appropriately fasten the two splints in three places on both extremities and in the middle, for with this arrangement the joint is prevented from bending to the right or left, and it remains in good position."
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	"And now a splint of wood according to the length of the joint has been applied; and the joint should be placed upon it so that it retains some movement."
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	"But particularly when you do this in fractures, especially when there is proper alignment."
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	"And appropriately examine the joint every day and study it carefully to ensure that you guard against inflammation or infection or other similar causes. And if any of these occurs, then you should apply what is necessary in order for it to be healed."
Capitol .xvii.	"Chapter XVII."
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	"Of the fracture of the ankle and bones of the foot."
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	"No ankle fracture happened at all; sometimes fractures happen on the foot bones; few foot toes have fractures happening, and they don't cause any trouble in their position."
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	"And if the foot bones have fractures and those bones are sometimes elevated above each other, then the patient places their foot on the ground prepared in such a way as to walk."
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	"And he presses one foot onto what is elevated by those bones, and presses on them, squeezing and twisting around the joints."
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	"And then they apply plaster and bandages on top of it, and place a small board with two flat heads on the front of the foot."
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	"And then they strengthen that bandage with downward traction, because you have wrapped it around with cloth and other causes as needed."
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	"And when three or four days have passed, then you untie the bandage, because you will find the bones twisted together, either crushed or displaced, and the operation on them is performed in this way:
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	"If some teeth are clenched, then restore those, align them thus with glue and stitch them back into place as I have shown you in the restoration of these hands."
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	"And then apply pressure on the bitten finger according to its length, and place it slightly lower than this table that I have shown you earlier, and stretch it with moderate tension."
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	"But if what is bitten of the bones are two or three or more, then you apply pressure on each finger according to its quantity wrapped in linen cloth, stretch the table towards the bottom of the foot, and stand it upright so that one of its ends rests on the belly of the foot for better retention."
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	"And remember not to forget that you should not consider all the causes mentioned to you in other fractures of accidents, and apply what is necessary according to each accident."
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter xviii
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the hip bone of a woman and the pubic bone and penis bone of a man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the hip bone of a woman is fractured, then make that cease in this way: wrap it in a bandage, incline it at the junction of both sides slightly, and hold it behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And moreover the midwife presses the hip bone from behind, and it is done on the hip bone in this way as I have said earlier; and also the woman is tilted backwards, and raises her buttocks little by little, for all this is forgotten until it is before the junction of the hip bones as I have said earlier and the fractured bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And moreover powder is applied on the buttocks, and when she wants to urinate, she moves her hip with ease and then urinates, and reduces and returns it according to the manner in which she placed it at the beginning, and again applies the first powder.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do this for seven days or so until that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take a bladder of a sheep and stretch it over the fracture of the hip with a reed pipe; and insert all the bladder into the hip bone, and blow through the reed pipe with force until the bladder is inflated within the hip bone, for the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And moreover it should be wrapped in cotton and kept for some days according to what we have recommended until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the pubic bone of a man or woman is fractured, then for its restoration and splinting, do what we have recommended for the hip bone.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And what is true is not hidden in these fractures near the groin which cause little inconvenience, especially to that person who has some study and use and understands this my book; for that fracture indicates to you in the greatest positions how truly it can be restored and reduced, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the case of a fractured penis of a man, take a guarguamela (a type of bandage) made of wool, and put it around the penis; and then apply over it a wrapping of cloth, and let it be wrapped up, and then let it lie for three days or so until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of fractures of bones when they are out of place.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	"It is suitable for one who has suffered a fracture with profuse bleeding, especially if the bone is large, such as those in the thigh or arm. Quickly perform phlebotomy if the conditions are favorable."
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	"If the bleeding is profuse and red, then you must use retention to prevent it from flowing further. If there are other causes, treat those as well."
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	"Therefore begin restoring the fracture on that same day, and do not delay this if no inflammation occurs."
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	"But if inflammation occurs, then delay the reduction until the seventh day, allowing the inflammation to subside. Do not approach it on the third or fourth day, as you will cause harm."
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	"But if the bone sticks out above the skin, then you should perform reduction with ease and minimal traction."
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	"But if you are not prepared for traction and cannot reduce it with your hands alone, then use this instrument. It is made of iron, with a length of seven or eight digits and a width according to the amount of bleeding. Therefore, it is necessary for the physician to have three or four of these on hand, according to what is needed in all types of fractures."
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	"And once it is reduced, apply a splint with gentle compression to prevent it from becoming displaced during the operation."
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	"And if the extremity is sharp and has a border on its sides, then its upper part should be thicker than its lower part, and its middle should have a greater thickness."
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	"This is how it looks:"
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	"And it is called in Greek 'Labre Volentz Atelarem', which means roughly 'stone of pain'."
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	"Why must the end of the limb be raised above the prominence of the bone?"
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	"And pull it back in such a way that the bone returns to its place, and is covered with some padding."
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	"And then force the ends of the fracture to come together, and if one end is too thin to grasp with the instrument, it is necessary for you to insert a small instrument between them so that it can grasp onto that bone."
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	"But if you cannot reduce the bone with what has been recommended here, then cut it with whatever tool you have available among those that we have mentioned; or saw it with one of the saws in whichever way seems most feasible to you."
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	"And also scrape away any roughness and small splinters remaining on the bone."
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	"And when the bone is reduced and during its reduction the patient feels very severe pain, know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; therefore do this, so that you may give great relief to the patient."
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	"When your restoration of the bone is complete, then wrap it in a cloth soaked in black stiptic wine, especially if it is summer time, and do not let any oil or other substance come into contact with it, so that putrefaction and corruption may not occur later."
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	"And also administer bandages at the time of completion of the bone restoration, and leave the dressing uncovered in such a way that you may insert the splint with forceps and use wrappings according to the quantity of the dressing."
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	"And be very careful that you do not stretch the dressing over the fracture, for many times foolish doctors have done this and caused death or corrupting illness or swelling in their patients, which is not good."
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	"And if your bandage is light, soft, and different from the bandages of other fractures."
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	"And if the dressing is large or is a bad dressing, and you fear that some of those unfortunate accidents which we have mentioned may occur on it, and you find pain in that place, then do not rely on bandages, but make a wrapping of hard cloths there instead of bandages and stretch it with them."
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	"And when after one or two days the dressing begins to grow warm in that place, then you remove from there the cloth which you had put on it with wine, and apply cataplasms, such as those by which we usually treat dressings, like a cataplasm of treacle and similar ones."
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	"And it is advisable for you to loosen the bandage and examine the dressing every day morning and evening until it is consolidated and firm, and the member should be prepared in such a way that putrefaction may flow from there to the parts below with ease."
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	"If many days pass and the dressing is not consolidated nor separated from the warmth, then you should know that here are the beginnings of gangrene, therefore you must examine the dressing with caution."
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	"And those gangrenous parts which are separated and removed you should cut away, but those which are not separated and cause the member to swell and cause pain, you should pierce according to what is possible for you."
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	"And if something like chyme or ichor occurs in the dressing, then it is stoimenia or some other species of corruption and putrefaction, therefore you should apply one of those which are mentioned here in its chapter regarding the cure of that."
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	"And regarding that in which I should speak better and you make your own judgment: when the bone is crushed, do not presume traction of it, nor extraction of it because many times death has occurred because of this; let putrefaction take its course there, for strong flux will come by itself after about 20 or 30 days; and then treat the dressing if you can see it, and if not leave it alone."
Capitol .xx.	"Chapter XX."
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	"On the treatment of inflammation that occurs in the region of some fracture."
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many times this condition occurs during the healing process of a fracture, especially near joints. It is identified by the distortion of the limb's shape. And it often prevents the limb from its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider whether the swelling is recent and administer those medications that have astringent properties like aloevera, ensens, myrrh, and acacia. Use them generously and mix them with either egg albumen, white vinegar or sour wine. Then place this mixture over the swelling wrapped in linen, applying pressure with a firm bandage.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the bandage remain in place for several days without removing it; and gradually remove it when the swelling has subsided. Or apply over it a lead plate descended from above because lead has the property to reduce all inflammation in limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the swelling has already turned into bone and is causing pain, then it must be cut open carefully, and make an incision along the natural crease of the limb, excising any excess flesh or bony protuberance. Then rinse it with warm water until it is healed. And dress it accordingly until it is completely healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of fractures when they are healed, but if the limb remains weak and does not align naturally
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture has healed, but the limb remains weak and crooked, it is usually due to one of several causes: either too much dissolution of the ligaments and tissues around the fracture site so that they do not heal properly; or excess tightening of the ligaments preventing adequate nourishment from reaching the limb; or too much embrocation applied to the area; or excessive movement before the bone has fully healed; or lack of blood circulation in the body due to weakness or debility.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for this is to ensure the patient receives proper nutrition in order to increase blood circulation and strengthen their body. Apply warm baths, and massage gently with gentle movements to stimulate healing and promote alignment of the limb.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And apply gentle traction to the limb using a splint in order to draw more nourishment to it.
